command.name: add_custom_command
command.desc: Add a custom build rule to the generated build system.

usage.value: (OUTPUT output1 [output2 ...] COMMAND command1 [ARGS] [args1...] [COMMAND command2 [ARGS] [args2...] ...] [MAIN_DEPENDENCY depend] [DEPENDS [depends...]] [BYPRODUCTS [files...]] [IMPLICIT_DEPENDS <lang1> depend1 [<lang2> depend2] ...] [WORKING_DIRECTORY dir] [COMMENT comment] [DEPFILE depfile] [JOB_POOL job_pool] [VERBATIM] [APPEND] [USES_TERMINAL] [COMMAND_EXPAND_LISTS])

(TARGET <target> PRE_BUILD | PRE_LINK | POST_BUILD COMMAND command1 [ARGS] [args1...] [COMMAND command2 [ARGS] [args2...] ...] [BYPRODUCTS [files...]] [WORKING_DIRECTORY dir] [COMMENT comment] [VERBATIM] [USES_TERMINAL] [COMMAND_EXPAND_LISTS])

command.name: add_custom_target
command.desc: Add a target with no output so it will always be built.

usage.value: (Name [ALL] [command1 [args1...]] [COMMAND command2 [args2...] ...] [DEPENDS depend depend depend ... ] [BYPRODUCTS [files...]] [WORKING_DIRECTORY dir] [COMMENT comment] [JOB_POOL job_pool] [VERBATIM] [USES_TERMINAL] [COMMAND_EXPAND_LISTS] [SOURCES src1 [src2...]])

command.desc: A short-hand signature is:

usage.value: ( <VAR> name | NAMES name1 [name2 ...] [HINTS path1 [path2 ... ENV var]] [PATHS path1 [path2 ... ENV var]] [PATH_SUFFIXES suffix1 [suffix2 ...]] [DOC "cache documentation string"] [REQUIRED] [NO_DEFAULT_PATH] [NO_PACKAGE_ROOT_PATH] [NO_CMAKE_PATH] [NO_CMAKE_ENVIRONMENT_PATH] [NO_SYSTEM_ENVIRONMENT_PATH] [NO_CMAKE_SYSTEM_PATH] [CMAKE_FIND_ROOT_PATH_BOTH | ONLY_CMAKE_FIND_ROOT_PATH | NO_CMAKE_FIND_ROOT_PATH] )
(<VAR> NAMES name PATHS paths... NO_DEFAULT_PATH) find_file (<VAR> NAMES name)

ENV var]] [PATH_SUFFIXES suffix1 [suffix2 ...]] [DOC "cache documentation string"] [REQUIRED] [NO_DEFAULT_PATH] [NO_PACKAGE_ROOT_PATH] [NO_CMAKE_PATH] [NO_CMAKE_ENVIRONMENT_PATH] [NO_SYSTEM_ENVIRONMENT_PATH] [NO_CMAKE_SYSTEM_PATH] [CMAKE_FIND_ROOT_PATH_BOTH | ONLY_CMAKE_FIND_ROOT_PATH | NO_CMAKE_FIND_ROOT_PATH] )
(<VAR> NAMES name PATHS paths... NO_DEFAULT_PATH) find_library (<VAR> NAMES name)

[NO_CMAKE_SYSTEM_PATH] [NO_CMAKE_SYSTEM_PACKAGE_REGISTRY] [CMAKE_FIND_ROOT_PATH_BOTH | ONLY_CMAKE_FIND_ROOT_PATH | NO_CMAKE_FIND_ROOT_PATH])

ENV var]] [PATH_SUFFIXES suffix1 [suffix2 ...]] [DOC "cache documentation string"] [REQUIRED] [NO_DEFAULT_PATH] [NO_PACKAGE_ROOT_PATH] [NO_CMAKE_PATH] [NO_CMAKE_ENVIRONMENT_PATH] [NO_SYSTEM_ENVIRONMENT_PATH] [NO_CMAKE_SYSTEM_PATH] [CMAKE_FIND_ROOT_PATH_BOTH | ONLY_CMAKE_FIND_ROOT_PATH | NO_CMAKE_FIND_ROOT_PATH] )
(<VAR> NAMES name PATHS paths... NO_DEFAULT_PATH) find_path (<VAR> NAMES name)

TYPE <type> | DESTINATION <dir> [FILE_PERMISSIONS permissions...] [DIRECTORY_PERMISSIONS permissions...] [USE_SOURCE_PERMISSIONS] [OPTIONAL] [MESSAGE_NEVER] [CONFIGURATIONS [Debug|Release|...]] [COMPONENT <component>] [EXCLUDE_FROM_ALL] [FILES_MATCHING] [[PATTERN <pattern> | REGEX <regex>] [EXCLUDE] [PERMISSIONS permissions...]] [...])

command.name: install_files
command.desc: This command has been superceded by the install() command. It is provided for compatibility with older CMake code. The FILES form is directly replaced by the FILES form of the install() command. The regexp form can be expressed more clearly using the GLOB form of the file() command.

command.name: install_programs
command.desc: This command has been superceded by the install() command. It is provided for compatibility with older CMake code. The FILES form is directly replaced by the PROGRAMS form of the install() command. The regexp form can be expressed more clearly using the GLOB form of the file() command.

command.name: install_targets
command.desc: This command has been superceded by the install() command. It is provided for compatibility with older CMake code.

command.name: math
command.desc: Evaluate a mathematical expression.

usage.value: (EXPR value "100 * 0xA" OUTPUT_FORMAT DECIMAL) # value is set to "1000" math(EXPR value "100 * 0xA" OUTPUT_FORMAT HEXADECIMAL) # value is set to "0x3e8"

command.name: message
command.desc: Log a message.

usage.value: (STATUS "Looking for someheader.h") #... do the checks, set checkSuccess with the result if(checkSuccess) message(STATUS "Looking for someheader.h - found") else() message(STATUS "Looking for someheader.h - not found") endif()

(CHECK_START "Finding my things") list(APPEND CMAKE_MESSAGE_INDENT " ") unset(missingComponents) message(CHECK_START "Finding partA") # ... do check, assume we find A message(CHECK_PASS "found") message(CHECK_START "Finding partB") # ... do check, assume we don't find B list(APPEND missingComponents B) message(CHECK_FAIL "not found") list(POP_BACK CMAKE_MESSAGE_INDENT) if(missingComponents) message(CHECK_FAIL "missing components: ${missingComponents}") else() message(CHECK_PASS "all components found") endif()

command.desc: The first argument is the file name, the rest of the arguments are messages to write. If the argument APPEND is specified, then the message will be appended.

property.name: <CONFIG>_OUTPUT_NAME
property.desc: Old per-configuration target file base name. Use OUTPUT_NAME_<CONFIG> instead.

property.name: <CONFIG>_POSTFIX
property.desc: Postfix to append to the target file name for configuration <CONFIG>.

property.name: ABSTRACT
property.desc: Is this source file an abstract class.

property.name: ADDITIONAL_CLEAN_FILES
property.desc: A ;-list of files or directories that will be removed as a part of the global clean target. It can be used to specify files and directories that are generated as part of building the target or that are directly associated with the target in some way (e.g. created as a result of running the target).

property.name: ADDITIONAL_MAKE_CLEAN_FILES
property.desc: Additional files to remove during the clean stage.

property.name: ADVANCED
property.desc: True if entry should be hidden by default in GUIs.

property.name: AIX_EXPORT_ALL_SYMBOLS
property.desc: On AIX, CMake automatically exports all symbols from shared libraries, and from executables with the ENABLE_EXPORTS target property set. Explicitly disable this boolean property to suppress the behavior and export no symbols by default. In this case it is expected that the project will use other means to export some symbols.

property.name: ALIASED_TARGET
property.desc: Name of target aliased by this target.

property.name: ALIAS_GLOBAL
property.desc: Read-only property indicating of whether an ALIAS target is globally visible.

property.name: ALLOW_DUPLICATE_CUSTOM_TARGETS
property.desc: Allow duplicate custom targets to be created.

property.name: ANDROID_ANT_ADDITIONAL_OPTIONS
property.desc: Set the additional options for Android Ant build system. This is a string value containing all command line options for the Ant build. This property is initialized by the value of the CMAKE_ANDROID_ANT_ADDITIONAL_OPTIONS variable if it is set when a target is created.

property.name: ANDROID_API
property.desc: When Cross Compiling for Android with NVIDIA Nsight Tegra Visual Studio Edition, this property sets the Android target API version (e.g. 15). The version number must be a positive decimal integer. This property is initialized by the value of the CMAKE_ANDROID_API variable if it is set when a target is created.

property.name: ANDROID_API_MIN
property.desc: Set the Android MIN API version (e.g. 9). The version number must be a positive decimal integer. This property is initialized by the value of the CMAKE_ANDROID_API_MIN variable if it is set when a target is created. Native code builds using this API version.

property.name: ANDROID_ARCH
property.desc: When Cross Compiling for Android with NVIDIA Nsight Tegra Visual Studio Edition, this property sets the Android target architecture.

property.name: ANDROID_ASSETS_DIRECTORIES
property.desc: Set the Android assets directories to copy into the main assets folder before build. This a string property that contains the directory paths separated by semicolon. This property is initialized by the value of the CMAKE_ANDROID_ASSETS_DIRECTORIES variable if it is set when a target is created.

property.name: ANDROID_GUI
property.desc: When Cross Compiling for Android with NVIDIA Nsight Tegra Visual Studio Edition, this property specifies whether to build an executable as an application package on Android.

property.name: ANDROID_JAR_DEPENDENCIES
property.desc: Set the Android property that specifies JAR dependencies. This is a string value property. This property is initialized by the value of the CMAKE_ANDROID_JAR_DEPENDENCIES variable if it is set when a target is created.

property.name: ANDROID_JAR_DIRECTORIES
property.desc: Set the Android property that specifies directories to search for the JAR libraries.

property.name: ANDROID_JAVA_SOURCE_DIR
property.desc: Set the Android property that defines the Java source code root directories. This a string property that contains the directory paths separated by semicolon. This property is initialized by the value of the CMAKE_ANDROID_JAVA_SOURCE_DIR variable if it is set when a target is created.

property.name: ANDROID_NATIVE_LIB_DEPENDENCIES
property.desc: Set the Android property that specifies the .so dependencies. This is a string property.

property.name: ANDROID_NATIVE_LIB_DIRECTORIES
property.desc: Set the Android property that specifies directories to search for the .so libraries.

property.name: ANDROID_PROCESS_MAX
property.desc: Set the Android property that defines the maximum number of a parallel Android NDK compiler processes (e.g. 4). This property is initialized by the value of the CMAKE_ANDROID_PROCESS_MAX variable if it is set when a target is created.

property.name: ANDROID_PROGUARD
property.desc: When this property is set to true that enables the ProGuard tool to shrink, optimize, and obfuscate the code by removing unused code and renaming classes, fields, and methods with semantically obscure names. This property is initialized by the value of the CMAKE_ANDROID_PROGUARD variable if it is set when a target is created.

property.name: ANDROID_PROGUARD_CONFIG_PATH
property.desc: Set the Android property that specifies the location of the ProGuard config file. Leave empty to use the default one. This a string property that contains the path to ProGuard config file. This property is initialized by the value of the CMAKE_ANDROID_PROGUARD_CONFIG_PATH variable if it is set when a target is created.

property.name: ANDROID_SECURE_PROPS_PATH
property.desc: Set the Android property that states the location of the secure properties file. This is a string property that contains the file path. This property is initialized by the value of the CMAKE_ANDROID_SECURE_PROPS_PATH variable if it is set when a target is created.

property.name: ANDROID_SKIP_ANT_STEP
property.desc: Set the Android property that defines whether or not to skip the Ant build step. This is a boolean property initialized by the value of the CMAKE_ANDROID_SKIP_ANT_STEP variable if it is set when a target is created.

property.name: ANDROID_STL_TYPE
property.desc: When Cross Compiling for Android with NVIDIA Nsight Tegra Visual Studio Edition, this property specifies the type of STL support for the project. This is a string property that could set to the one of the following values:

property.name: ARCHIVE_OUTPUT_DIRECTORY
property.desc: Output directory in which to build ARCHIVE target files.

property.name: ARCHIVE_OUTPUT_DIRECTORY_<CONFIG>
property.desc: Per-configuration output directory for ARCHIVE target files.

property.name: ARCHIVE_OUTPUT_NAME
property.desc: Output name for ARCHIVE target files.

property.name: ARCHIVE_OUTPUT_NAME_<CONFIG>
property.desc: Per-configuration output name for ARCHIVE target files.

property.name: ASM-ATT_CLANG_TIDY
property.desc: This property is implemented only when <LANG> is C or CXX.

property.name: ASM-ATT_COMPILER_LAUNCHER
property.desc: This property is implemented only when <LANG> is C, CXX, Fortran, OBJC, OBJCXX, or CUDA.

property.name: ASM-ATT_CPPCHECK
property.desc: This property is supported only when <LANG> is C or CXX.

property.name: ASM-ATT_CPPLINT
property.desc: This property is supported only when <LANG> is C or CXX.

property.name: ASM-ATT_INCLUDE_WHAT_YOU_USE
property.desc: This property is implemented only when <LANG> is C or CXX.

property.name: ASM-ATT_VISIBILITY_PRESET
property.desc: Value for symbol visibility compile flags

property.name: ASM-MASM_CLANG_TIDY
property.desc: This property is implemented only when <LANG> is C or CXX.

property.name: ASM-MASM_COMPILER_LAUNCHER
property.desc: This property is implemented only when <LANG> is C, CXX, Fortran, OBJC, OBJCXX, or CUDA.

property.name: ASM-MASM_CPPCHECK
property.desc: This property is supported only when <LANG> is C or CXX.

property.name: ASM-MASM_CPPLINT
property.desc: This property is supported only when <LANG> is C or CXX.

property.name: ASM-MASM_INCLUDE_WHAT_YOU_USE
property.desc: This property is implemented only when <LANG> is C or CXX.

property.name: ASM-MASM_VISIBILITY_PRESET
property.desc: Value for symbol visibility compile flags

property.name: ASM-NASM_CLANG_TIDY
property.desc: This property is implemented only when <LANG> is C or CXX.

property.name: ASM-NASM_COMPILER_LAUNCHER

property.name: ATTACHED_FILES
property.desc: Attach a list of files to a dashboard submission.

property.name: ATTACHED_FILES_ON_FAIL
property.desc: Attach a list of files to a dashboard submission if the test fails.

property.name: AUTOGEN_BUILD_DIR
property.desc: Directory where AUTOMOC, AUTOUIC and AUTORCC generate files for the target.

property.name: AUTOGEN_ORIGIN_DEPENDS
property.desc: Switch for forwarding origin target dependencies to the corresponding _autogen target.

property.name: AUTOGEN_PARALLEL
property.desc: Number of parallel moc or uic processes to start when using AUTOMOC and AUTOUIC.

property.name: AUTOGEN_SOURCE_GROUP
property.desc: Name of the source_group() for AUTOMOC and AUTORCC generated files.

property.name: AUTOGEN_TARGETS_FOLDER
property.desc: Name of FOLDER for *_autogen targets that are added automatically by CMake for targets for which AUTOMOC is enabled.

property.name: AUTOGEN_TARGET_DEPENDS
property.desc: Additional target dependencies of the corresponding _autogen target.

property.name: AUTOMOC
property.desc: Should the target be processed with auto-moc (for Qt projects).

property.name: AUTOMOC_COMPILER_PREDEFINES
property.desc: Boolean value used by AUTOMOC to determine if the compiler pre definitions file moc_predefs.h should be generated.

property.name: AUTOMOC_DEPEND_FILTERS
property.desc: Filter definitions used by AUTOMOC to extract file names from a source file that are registered as additional dependencies for the moc file of the source file.

property.name: AUTOMOC_EXECUTABLE
property.desc: AUTOMOC_EXECUTABLE is file path pointing to the moc executable to use for AUTOMOC enabled files. Setting this property will make CMake skip the automatic detection of the moc binary as well as the sanity-tests normally run to ensure that the binary is available and working as expected.

property.name: AUTOMOC_MACRO_NAMES
property.desc: A semicolon-separated list list of macro names used by AUTOMOC to determine if a C++ file needs to be processed by moc.

property.name: AUTOMOC_MOC_OPTIONS
property.desc: Additional options for moc when using AUTOMOC

property.name: AUTOMOC_PATH_PREFIX
property.desc: When this property is ON, CMake will generate the -p path prefix option for moc on AUTOMOC enabled Qt targets.

property.name: AUTOMOC_SOURCE_GROUP
property.desc: Name of the source_group() for AUTOMOC generated files.

property.name: AUTOMOC_TARGETS_FOLDER
property.desc: Name of FOLDER for *_autogen targets that are added automatically by CMake for targets for which AUTOMOC is enabled.

property.name: AUTORCC
property.desc: Should the target be processed with auto-rcc (for Qt projects).

property.name: AUTORCC_EXECUTABLE
property.desc: AUTORCC_EXECUTABLE is file path pointing to the rcc executable to use for AUTORCC enabled files. Setting this property will make CMake skip the automatic detection of the rcc binary as well as the sanity-tests normally run to ensure that the binary is available and working as expected.

property.name: AUTORCC_OPTIONS
property.desc: Additional options for rcc when using AUTORCC

property.name: AUTORCC_SOURCE_GROUP
property.desc: Name of the source_group() for AUTORCC generated files.

property.name: AUTOUIC
property.desc: Should the target be processed with auto-uic (for Qt projects).

property.name: AUTOUIC_EXECUTABLE
property.desc: AUTOUIC_EXECUTABLE is file path pointing to the uic executable to use for AUTOUIC enabled files. Setting this property will make CMake skip the automatic detection of the uic binary as well as the sanity-tests normally run to ensure that the binary is available and working as expected.

property.name: AUTOUIC_OPTIONS
property.desc: Additional options for uic when using AUTOUIC

property.name: AUTOUIC_SEARCH_PATHS
property.desc: Search path list used by AUTOUIC to find included .ui files.

property.name: BINARY_DIR
property.desc: This read-only property reports the value of the CMAKE_CURRENT_BINARY_DIR variable in the directory in which the target was defined.

property.name: BUILDSYSTEM_TARGETS
property.desc: This read-only directory property contains a semicolon-separated list of buildsystem targets added in the directory by calls to the add_library(), add_executable(), and add_custom_target() commands. The list does not include any Imported Targets or Alias Targets, but does include Interface Libraries. Each entry in the list is the logical name of a target, suitable to pass to the get_property() command TARGET option.

property.name: BUILD_RPATH
property.desc: A semicolon-separated list specifying runtime path (RPATH) entries to add to binaries linked in the build tree (for platforms that support it). The entries will not be used for binaries in the install tree. See also the INSTALL_RPATH target property.

property.name: BUILD_RPATH_USE_ORIGIN
property.desc: Whether to use relative paths for the build RPATH.

property.name: BUILD_WITH_INSTALL_NAME_DIR
property.desc: BUILD_WITH_INSTALL_NAME_DIR is a boolean specifying whether the macOS install_name of a target in the build tree uses the directory given by INSTALL_NAME_DIR. This setting only applies to targets on macOS.

property.name: BUILD_WITH_INSTALL_RPATH
property.desc: BUILD_WITH_INSTALL_RPATH is a boolean specifying whether to link the target in the build tree with the INSTALL_RPATH. This takes precedence over SKIP_BUILD_RPATH and avoids the need for relinking before installation.

property.name: BUNDLE
property.desc: This target is a CFBundle on the macOS.

property.name: BUNDLE_EXTENSION
property.desc: The file extension used to name a BUNDLE, a FRAMEWORK, or a MACOSX_BUNDLE target on the macOS and iOS.

property.name: CACHE_VARIABLES
property.desc: List of cache variables available in the current directory.

property.name: CLEAN_NO_CUSTOM
property.desc: Set to true to tell Makefile Generators not to remove the outputs of custom commands for this directory during the make clean operation. This is ignored on other generators because it is not possible to implement.

property.name: CMAKE_CONFIGURE_DEPENDS
property.desc: Tell CMake about additional input files to the configuration process. If any named file is modified the build system will re-run CMake to re-configure the file and generate the build system again.

property.name: CMAKE_CUDA_KNOWN_FEATURES
property.desc: List of CUDA features known to this version of CMake.

property.name: CMAKE_CXX_KNOWN_FEATURES
property.desc: List of C++ features known to this version of CMake.

property.name: CMAKE_C_KNOWN_FEATURES
property.desc: List of C features known to this version of CMake.

property.name: CMAKE_ROLE
property.desc: Tells what mode the current running script is in. Could be one of several values:

property.name: COMMON_LANGUAGE_RUNTIME
property.desc: By setting this target property, the target is configured to build with C++/CLI support.

property.name: COMPATIBLE_INTERFACE_BOOL
property.desc: Properties which must be compatible with their link interface

property.name: COMPATIBLE_INTERFACE_NUMBER_MAX
property.desc: Properties whose maximum value from the link interface will be used.

property.name: COMPATIBLE_INTERFACE_NUMBER_MIN
property.desc: Properties whose maximum value from the link interface will be used.

property.name: COMPATIBLE_INTERFACE_STRING
property.desc: Properties which must be string-compatible with their link interface

property.name: COMPILE_DEFINITIONS
property.desc: Preprocessor definitions for compiling a target’s sources.

property.name: COMPILE_DEFINITIONS_<CONFIG>
property.desc: Ignored. See CMake Policy CMP0043.

property.name: COMPILE_FEATURES
property.desc: Compiler features enabled for this target.

property.name: COMPILE_FLAGS
property.desc: Additional flags to use when compiling this target’s sources.

property.name: COMPILE_OPTIONS
property.desc: List of options to pass to the compiler.

property.name: COMPILE_PDB_NAME
property.desc: Output name for the MS debug symbol .pdb file generated by the compiler while building source files.

property.name: COMPILE_PDB_NAME_<CONFIG>
property.desc: Per-configuration output name for the MS debug symbol .pdb file generated by the compiler while building source files.

property.name: COMPILE_PDB_OUTPUT_DIRECTORY
property.desc: Output directory for the MS debug symbol .pdb file generated by the compiler while building source files.

property.name: COMPILE_PDB_OUTPUT_DIRECTORY_<CONFIG>
property.desc: Per-configuration output directory for the MS debug symbol .pdb file generated by the compiler while building source files.

property.name: COST
property.desc: This property describes the cost of a test. When parallel testing is enabled, tests in the test set will be run in descending order of cost. Projects can explicitly define the cost of a test by setting this property to a floating point value.

property.name: CPACK_DESKTOP_SHORTCUTS
property.desc: Species a list of shortcut names that should be created on the Desktop for this file.

property.name: CPACK_NEVER_OVERWRITE
property.desc: Request that this file not be overwritten on install or reinstall.

property.name: CPACK_PERMANENT
property.desc: Request that this file not be removed on uninstall.

property.name: CPACK_STARTUP_SHORTCUTS
property.desc: Species a list of shortcut names that should be created in the Startup folder for this file.

property.name: CPACK_START_MENU_SHORTCUTS

property.name: CPACK_WIX_ACL

property.name: CROSSCOMPILING_EMULATOR
property.desc: Use the given emulator to run executables created when crosscompiling. This command will be added as a prefix to add_test(), add_custom_command(), and add_custom_target() commands for built target system executables.

property.name: DEFINITIONS
property.desc: For CMake 2.4 compatibility only. Use COMPILE_DEFINITIONS instead.

property.name: DEPENDS
property.desc: Specifies that this test should only be run after the specified list of tests.

property.name: DEPLOYMENT_ADDITIONAL_FILES
property.desc: Set the WinCE project AdditionalFiles in DeploymentTool in .vcproj files generated by the Visual Studio 9 2008 generator. This is useful when you want to debug on remote WinCE device. Specify additional files that will be copied to the device. For example:

property.name: DEPLOYMENT_REMOTE_DIRECTORY
property.desc: Set the WinCE project RemoteDirectory in DeploymentTool and RemoteExecutable in DebuggerTool in .vcproj files generated by the Visual Studio 9 2008 generator. This is useful when you want to debug on remote WinCE device. For example:

property.name: DEPRECATION
property.desc: Deprecation message from imported target’s developer.

property.name: DISABLED
property.desc: If set to True, the test will be skipped and its status will be ‘Not Run’. A DISABLED test will not be counted in the total number of tests and its completion status will be reported to CDash as Disabled.

property.name: DISABLED_FEATURES
property.desc: List of features which are disabled during the CMake run.

property.name: DISABLE_PRECOMPILE_HEADERS
property.desc: Disables the precompilation of header files specified by PRECOMPILE_HEADERS property.

property.name: DOTNET_TARGET_FRAMEWORK
property.desc: Specify the .NET target framework.

property.name: DOTNET_TARGET_FRAMEWORK_VERSION
property.desc: Specify the .NET target framework version.

property.name: ECLIPSE_EXTRA_CPROJECT_CONTENTS
property.desc: Additional contents to be inserted into the generated Eclipse cproject file.

property.name: ECLIPSE_EXTRA_NATURES
property.desc: List of natures to add to the generated Eclipse project file.

property.name: ENABLED_FEATURES
property.desc: List of features which are enabled during the CMake run.

property.name: ENABLED_LANGUAGES
property.desc: Read-only property that contains the list of currently enabled languages

property.name: ENABLE_EXPORTS
property.desc: Specify whether an executable exports symbols for loadable modules.

property.name: ENVIRONMENT
property.desc: Specify environment variables that should be defined for running a test.

property.name: EXCLUDE_FROM_ALL
property.desc: Set this target property to a true (or false) value to exclude (or include) the target from the “all” target of the containing directory and its ancestors. If excluded, running e.g. make in the containing directory or its ancestors will not build the target by default.

property.name: EXCLUDE_FROM_DEFAULT_BUILD
property.desc: Exclude target from Build Solution.

property.name: EXCLUDE_FROM_DEFAULT_BUILD_<CONFIG>
property.desc: Per-configuration version of target exclusion from Build Solution.

property.name: EXPORT_NAME
property.desc: Exported name for target files.

property.name: EXPORT_PROPERTIES
property.desc: List additional properties to export for a target.

property.name: EXTERNAL_OBJECT
property.desc: If set to true then this is an object file.

property.name: EchoString
property.desc: A message to be displayed when the target is built.

property.name: FAIL_REGULAR_EXPRESSION
property.desc: If the output matches this regular expression the test will fail.

property.name: FIND_LIBRARY_USE_LIB32_PATHS
property.desc: Whether the find_library() command should automatically search lib32 directories.

property.name: FIND_LIBRARY_USE_LIB64_PATHS
property.desc: Whether find_library() should automatically search lib64 directories.

property.name: FIND_LIBRARY_USE_LIBX32_PATHS
property.desc: Whether the find_library() command should automatically search libx32 directories.

property.name: FIND_LIBRARY_USE_OPENBSD_VERSIONING
property.desc: Whether find_library() should find OpenBSD-style shared libraries.

property.name: FIXTURES_CLEANUP
property.desc: Specifies a list of fixtures for which the test is to be treated as a cleanup test. These fixture names are distinct from test case names and are not required to have any similarity to the names of tests associated with them.

property.name: FIXTURES_REQUIRED
property.desc: Specifies a list of fixtures the test requires. Fixture names are case sensitive and they are not required to have any similarity to test names.

property.name: FIXTURES_SETUP
property.desc: Specifies a list of fixtures for which the test is to be treated as a setup test. These fixture names are distinct from test case names and are not required to have any similarity to the names of tests associated with them.

property.name: FOLDER
property.desc: Set the folder name. Use to organize targets in an IDE.

property.name: FRAMEWORK
property.desc: Build SHARED or STATIC library as Framework Bundle on the macOS and iOS.

property.name: FRAMEWORK_MULTI_CONFIG_POSTFIX_<CONFIG>
property.desc: Postfix to append to the framework file name for configuration <CONFIG>, when using a multi-config generator (like Xcode and Ninja Multi-Config).

property.name: FRAMEWORK_VERSION
property.desc: Version of a framework created using the FRAMEWORK target property (e.g. A).

property.name: Fortran_CLANG_TIDY
property.desc: This property is implemented only when <LANG> is C or CXX.

property.name: Fortran_COMPILER_LAUNCHER
property.desc: This property is implemented only when <LANG> is C, CXX, Fortran, OBJC, OBJCXX, or CUDA.

property.name: Fortran_CPPCHECK
property.desc: This property is supported only when <LANG> is C or CXX.

property.name: Fortran_CPPLINT
property.desc: This property is supported only when <LANG> is C or CXX.

property.name: Fortran_FORMAT
property.desc: Set to FIXED or FREE to indicate the Fortran source layout.

property.name: Fortran_INCLUDE_WHAT_YOU_USE
property.desc: This property is implemented only when <LANG> is C or CXX.

property.name: Fortran_MODULE_DIRECTORY
property.desc: Specify output directory for Fortran modules provided by the target.

property.name: Fortran_PREPROCESS
property.desc: Control whether the Fortran source file should be unconditionally preprocessed.

property.name: Fortran_VISIBILITY_PRESET
property.desc: Value for symbol visibility compile flags

property.name: GENERATED
property.desc: Is this source file generated as part of the build or CMake process.

property.name: GENERATOR_FILE_NAME
property.desc: Generator’s file for this target.

property.name: GENERATOR_IS_MULTI_CONFIG
property.desc: Read-only property that is true on multi-configuration generators.

property.name: GHS_INTEGRITY_APP
property.desc: ON / OFF boolean to determine if an executable target should be treated as an Integrity Application.

property.name: GHS_NO_SOURCE_GROUP_FILE
property.desc: ON / OFF boolean to control if the project file for a target should be one single file or multiple files.

property.name: GLOBAL_DEPENDS_DEBUG_MODE
property.desc: Enable global target dependency graph debug mode.

property.name: GLOBAL_DEPENDS_NO_CYCLES
property.desc: Disallow global target dependency graph cycles.

property.name: GNUtoMS
property.desc: Convert GNU import library (.dll.a) to MS format (.lib).

property.name: HAS_CXX
property.desc: Link the target using the C++ linker tool (obsolete).

property.name: HEADER_FILE_ONLY
property.desc: Is this source file only a header file.

property.name: HELPSTRING
property.desc: Help associated with entry in GUIs.

property.name: IMPLICIT_DEPENDS_INCLUDE_TRANSFORM
property.desc: Specify #include line transforms for dependencies in a target.

property.name: IMPORTED
property.desc: Read-only indication of whether a target is IMPORTED.

property.desc: Property to define if the target uses C++/CLI.

property.name: IMPORTED_CONFIGURATIONS
property.desc: Configurations provided for an IMPORTED target.

property.name: IMPORTED_GLOBAL
property.desc: Indication of whether an IMPORTED target is globally visible.

property.name: IMPORTED_IMPLIB

property.name: IMPORTED_IMPLIB_<CONFIG>
property.desc: <CONFIG>-specific version of IMPORTED_IMPLIB property.

property.name: IMPORTED_LIBNAME

property.name: IMPORTED_LINK_DEPENDENT_LIBRARIES

property.name: IMPORTED_LINK_DEPENDENT_LIBRARIES_<CONFIG>
property.desc: <CONFIG>-specific version of IMPORTED_LINK_DEPENDENT_LIBRARIES.

property.name: IMPORTED_LINK_INTERFACE_LANGUAGES

property.name: IMPORTED_LINK_INTERFACE_LANGUAGES_<CONFIG>
property.desc: <CONFIG>-specific version of IMPORTED_LINK_INTERFACE_LANGUAGES.

property.name: IMPORTED_LINK_INTERFACE_LIBRARIES
property.desc: Transitive link interface of an IMPORTED target.

property.name: IMPORTED_LINK_INTERFACE_LIBRARIES_<CONFIG>
property.desc: <CONFIG>-specific version of IMPORTED_LINK_INTERFACE_LIBRARIES.

property.name: IMPORTED_LINK_INTERFACE_MULTIPLICITY

property.name: IMPORTED_LINK_INTERFACE_MULTIPLICITY_<CONFIG>
property.desc: <CONFIG>-specific version of IMPORTED_LINK_INTERFACE_MULTIPLICITY.

property.name: IMPORTED_LOCATION

property.name: IMPORTED_LOCATION_<CONFIG>
