variable.desc: Default value for C_STANDARD property of targets.

variable.name: CMAKE_C_STANDARD_INCLUDE_DIRECTORIES
variable.desc: Include directories to be used for every source file compiled with the <LANG> compiler. This is meant for specification of system include directories needed by the language for the current platform. The directories always appear at the end of the include path passed to the compiler.

variable.name: CMAKE_C_STANDARD_LIBRARIES
variable.desc: Libraries linked into every executable and shared library linked for language <LANG>. This is meant for specification of system libraries needed by the language for the current platform.

variable.name: CMAKE_C_STANDARD_REQUIRED
variable.desc: Default value for C_STANDARD_REQUIRED property of targets.

variable.name: CMAKE_C_VISIBILITY_PRESET
variable.desc: Default value for the <LANG>_VISIBILITY_PRESET target property when a target is created.

variable.name: CMAKE_DEBUG_POSTFIX
variable.desc: See variable CMAKE_<CONFIG>_POSTFIX.

variable.name: CMAKE_DEBUG_TARGET_PROPERTIES
variable.desc: Enables tracing output for target properties.

variable.name: CMAKE_DEFAULT_BUILD_TYPE
variable.desc: Specifies the configuration to use by default in a build.ninja file in the Ninja Multi-Config generator. If this variable is specified, build.ninja uses build rules from build-<Config>.ninja by default. All custom commands are executed with this configuration. If the variable is not specified, the first item from CMAKE_CONFIGURATION_TYPES is used instead.

variable.name: CMAKE_DEFAULT_CONFIGS
variable.desc: Specifies a semicolon-separated list of configurations to build for a target in build.ninja if no :<Config> suffix is specified in the Ninja Multi-Config generator. If it is set to all, all configurations from CMAKE_CROSS_CONFIGS are used. If it is not specified, it defaults to CMAKE_DEFAULT_BUILD_TYPE.

variable.name: CMAKE_DEPENDS_IN_PROJECT_ONLY
variable.desc: When set to TRUE in a directory, the build system produced by the Makefile Generators is set up to only consider dependencies on source files that appear either in the source or in the binary directories. Changes to source files outside of these directories will not cause rebuilds.

variable.name: CMAKE_DIRECTORY_LABELS
variable.desc: Specify labels for the current directory.

variable.name: CMAKE_DISABLE_FIND_PACKAGE_<PackageName>
variable.desc: Variable for disabling find_package() calls.

variable.name: CMAKE_DISABLE_PRECOMPILE_HEADERS
variable.desc: Default value for DISABLE_PRECOMPILE_HEADERS of targets.

variable.name: CMAKE_DL_LIBS
variable.desc: Name of library containing dlopen and dlclose.

variable.name: CMAKE_DOTNET_TARGET_FRAMEWORK
variable.desc: Default value for DOTNET_TARGET_FRAMEWORK property of targets.

variable.name: CMAKE_DOTNET_TARGET_FRAMEWORK_VERSION
variable.desc: Default value for DOTNET_TARGET_FRAMEWORK_VERSION property of targets.

variable.name: CMAKE_ECLIPSE_GENERATE_LINKED_RESOURCES
variable.desc: This cache variable is used by the Eclipse project generator. See cmake-generators(7).

variable.name: CMAKE_ECLIPSE_GENERATE_SOURCE_PROJECT
variable.desc: This cache variable is used by the Eclipse project generator. See cmake-generators(7).

variable.name: CMAKE_ECLIPSE_MAKE_ARGUMENTS
variable.desc: This cache variable is used by the Eclipse project generator. See cmake-generators(7).

variable.name: CMAKE_ECLIPSE_RESOURCE_ENCODING
variable.desc: This cache variable tells the Eclipse CDT4 project generator to set the resource encoding to the given value in generated project files. If no value is given, no encoding will be set.

variable.name: CMAKE_ECLIPSE_VERSION
variable.desc: This cache variable is used by the Eclipse project generator. See cmake-generators(7).

variable.name: CMAKE_EDIT_COMMAND
variable.desc: Full path to cmake-gui(1) or ccmake(1). Defined only for Makefile Generators when not using an “extra” generator for an IDE.

variable.name: CMAKE_ENABLE_EXPORTS
variable.desc: Specify whether executables export symbols for loadable modules.

variable.name: CMAKE_ERROR_DEPRECATED
variable.desc: Whether to issue errors for deprecated functionality.

variable.name: CMAKE_ERROR_ON_ABSOLUTE_INSTALL_DESTINATION
variable.desc: Ask cmake_install.cmake script to error out as soon as a file with absolute INSTALL DESTINATION is encountered.

variable.name: CMAKE_EXECUTABLE_SUFFIX
variable.desc: The suffix for executables on this platform.

variable.name: CMAKE_EXECUTE_PROCESS_COMMAND_ECHO
variable.desc: If this variable is set to STDERR, STDOUT or NONE then commands in execute_process() calls will be printed to either stderr or stdout or not at all.

variable.name: CMAKE_EXE_LINKER_FLAGS
variable.desc: Linker flags to be used to create executables.

variable.name: CMAKE_EXE_LINKER_FLAGS_<CONFIG>
variable.desc: Flags to be used when linking an executable.

variable.name: CMAKE_EXE_LINKER_FLAGS_<CONFIG>_INIT
variable.desc: Value used to initialize the CMAKE_EXE_LINKER_FLAGS_<CONFIG> cache entry the first time a build tree is configured. This variable is meant to be set by a toolchain file. CMake may prepend or append content to the value based on the environment and target platform.

variable.name: CMAKE_EXE_LINKER_FLAGS_INIT
variable.desc: Value used to initialize the CMAKE_EXE_LINKER_FLAGS cache entry the first time a build tree is configured. This variable is meant to be set by a toolchain file. CMake may prepend or append content to the value based on the environment and target platform.

variable.name: CMAKE_EXPORT_COMPILE_COMMANDS
variable.desc: Enable/Disable output of compile commands during generation.

variable.name: CMAKE_EXPORT_NO_PACKAGE_REGISTRY
variable.desc: Disable the export(PACKAGE) command when CMP0090 is not set to NEW.

variable.name: CMAKE_EXPORT_PACKAGE_REGISTRY
variable.desc: Enables the export(PACKAGE) command when CMP0090 is set to NEW.

variable.name: CMAKE_EXTRA_GENERATOR
variable.desc: The extra generator used to build the project. See cmake-generators(7).

variable.name: CMAKE_EXTRA_SHARED_LIBRARY_SUFFIXES
variable.desc: Additional suffixes for shared libraries.

variable.name: CMAKE_FIND_APPBUNDLE
variable.desc: This variable affects how find_* commands choose between macOS Application Bundles and unix-style package components.

variable.name: CMAKE_FIND_DEBUG_MODE
variable.desc: Print extra find call information for the following commands to standard error:

variable.name: CMAKE_FIND_FRAMEWORK
variable.desc: This variable affects how find_* commands choose between macOS Frameworks and unix-style package components.

variable.name: CMAKE_FIND_LIBRARY_CUSTOM_LIB_SUFFIX
variable.desc: Specify a <suffix> to tell the find_library() command to search in a lib<suffix> directory before each lib directory that would normally be searched.

variable.name: CMAKE_FIND_LIBRARY_PREFIXES
variable.desc: Prefixes to prepend when looking for libraries.

variable.name: CMAKE_FIND_LIBRARY_SUFFIXES
variable.desc: Suffixes to append when looking for libraries.

variable.name: CMAKE_FIND_NO_INSTALL_PREFIX
variable.desc: Exclude the values of the CMAKE_INSTALL_PREFIX and CMAKE_STAGING_PREFIX variables from CMAKE_SYSTEM_PREFIX_PATH. CMake adds these project-destination prefixes to CMAKE_SYSTEM_PREFIX_PATH by default in order to support building a series of dependent packages and installing them into a common prefix. Set CMAKE_FIND_NO_INSTALL_PREFIX to TRUE to suppress this behavior.

variable.name: CMAKE_FIND_PACKAGE_NAME
variable.desc: Defined by the find_package() command while loading a find module to record the caller-specified package name. See command documentation for details.

variable.name: CMAKE_FIND_PACKAGE_NO_PACKAGE_REGISTRY
variable.desc: By default this variable is not set. If neither CMAKE_FIND_USE_PACKAGE_REGISTRY nor CMAKE_FIND_PACKAGE_NO_PACKAGE_REGISTRY is set, then find_package() will use the User Package Registry unless the NO_CMAKE_PACKAGE_REGISTRY option is provided.

variable.name: CMAKE_FIND_PACKAGE_NO_SYSTEM_PACKAGE_REGISTRY
variable.desc: By default this variable is not set. If neither CMAKE_FIND_USE_SYSTEM_PACKAGE_REGISTRY nor CMAKE_FIND_PACKAGE_NO_SYSTEM_PACKAGE_REGISTRY is set, then find_package() will use the System Package Registry unless the NO_CMAKE_SYSTEM_PACKAGE_REGISTRY option is provided.

variable.name: CMAKE_FIND_PACKAGE_PREFER_CONFIG
variable.desc: Tell find_package() to try “Config” mode before “Module” mode if no mode was specified.

variable.name: CMAKE_FIND_PACKAGE_RESOLVE_SYMLINKS
variable.desc: Set to TRUE to tell find_package() calls to resolve symbolic links in the value of <PackageName>_DIR.

variable.name: CMAKE_FIND_PACKAGE_SORT_DIRECTION
variable.desc: The sorting direction used by CMAKE_FIND_PACKAGE_SORT_ORDER. It can assume one of the following values:

variable.name: CMAKE_FIND_PACKAGE_SORT_ORDER
variable.desc: The default order for sorting packages found using find_package(). It can assume one of the following values:

variable.name: CMAKE_FIND_PACKAGE_WARN_NO_MODULE
variable.desc: Tell find_package() to warn if called without an explicit mode.

variable.name: CMAKE_FIND_ROOT_PATH
variable.desc: Semicolon-separated list of root paths to search on the filesystem.

variable.name: CMAKE_FIND_ROOT_PATH_MODE_INCLUDE
variable.desc: This variable controls whether the CMAKE_FIND_ROOT_PATH and CMAKE_SYSROOT are used by find_file() and find_path().

variable.name: CMAKE_FIND_ROOT_PATH_MODE_LIBRARY
variable.desc: This variable controls whether the CMAKE_FIND_ROOT_PATH and CMAKE_SYSROOT are used by find_library().

variable.name: CMAKE_FIND_ROOT_PATH_MODE_PACKAGE

variable.desc: Controls the default behavior of the following commands for whether or not to search paths provided by platform-specific cmake variables:

variable.name: CMAKE_FIND_USE_SYSTEM_PACKAGE_REGISTRY

variable.name: CMAKE_FOLDER

variable.name: CMAKE_FRAMEWORK

variable.name: CMAKE_FRAMEWORK_MULTI_CONFIG_POSTFIX_<CONFIG>

variable.name: CMAKE_FRAMEWORK_PATH

variable.name: CMAKE_Fortran_ANDROID_TOOLCHAIN_MACHINE

variable.name: CMAKE_Fortran_ANDROID_TOOLCHAIN_PREFIX
variable.desc: When Cross Compiling for Android this variable contains the absolute path prefixing the toolchain GNU compiler and its binutils.

variable.name: CMAKE_Fortran_ANDROID_TOOLCHAIN_SUFFIX
variable.desc: When Cross Compiling for Android this variable contains the host platform suffix of the toolchain GNU compiler and its binutils.

variable.name: CMAKE_Fortran_ARCHIVE_APPEND

variable.name: CMAKE_Fortran_FLAGS
variable.desc: Value used to initialize the CMAKE_<LANG>_FLAGS_<CONFIG> cache entry the first time a build tree is configured for language <LANG>. This variable is meant to be set by a toolchain file. CMake may prepend or append content to the value based on the environment and target platform.

variable.name: CMAKE_Fortran_FLAGS_DEBUG
variable.desc: This variable is the Debug variant of the CMAKE_<LANG>_FLAGS_<CONFIG> variable.

variable.name: CMAKE_Fortran_FLAGS_DEBUG_INIT
variable.desc: This variable is the Debug variant of the CMAKE_<LANG>_FLAGS_<CONFIG>_INIT variable.

variable.name: CMAKE_Fortran_FLAGS_INIT
variable.desc: Value used to initialize the CMAKE_<LANG>_FLAGS cache entry the first time a build tree is configured for language <LANG>. This variable is meant to be set by a toolchain file. CMake may prepend or append content to the value based on the environment and target platform. For example, the contents of a xxxFLAGS environment variable will be prepended, where xxx will be language-specific but not necessarily the same as <LANG> (e.g. CXXFLAGS for CXX, FFLAGS for Fortran, and so on).

variable.name: CMAKE_Fortran_FLAGS_MINSIZEREL
variable.desc: This variable is the MinSizeRel variant of the CMAKE_<LANG>_FLAGS_<CONFIG> variable.

variable.name: CMAKE_Fortran_FLAGS_MINSIZEREL_INIT
variable.desc: This variable is the MinSizeRel variant of the CMAKE_<LANG>_FLAGS_<CONFIG>_INIT variable.

variable.name: CMAKE_Fortran_FLAGS_RELEASE_INIT

variable.name: CMAKE_Fortran_FLAGS_RELWITHDEBINFO

variable.desc: This variable is the RelWithDebInfo variant of the CMAKE_<LANG>_FLAGS_<CONFIG>_INIT variable.

variable.name: CMAKE_Fortran_LINKER_WRAPPER_FLAG_SEP
variable.desc: This variable is used with CMAKE_<LANG>_LINKER_WRAPPER_FLAG variable to format LINKER: prefix in the link options (see add_link_options() and target_link_options()).

variable.name: CMAKE_Fortran_LINK_LIBRARY_SUFFIX

variable.desc: True for Oracle Solaris operating systems.

variable.name: CMAKE_IGNORE_PATH
variable.desc: Semicolon-separated list of directories to be ignored by the find_program(), find_library(), find_file(), and find_path() commands. This is useful in cross-compiling environments where some system directories contain incompatible but possibly linkable libraries. For example, on cross-compiled cluster environments, this allows a user to ignore directories containing libraries meant for the front-end machine.

variable.name: CMAKE_IMPORT_LIBRARY_SUFFIX

variable.name: CMAKE_INCLUDE_DIRECTORIES_PROJECT_BEFORE

variable.desc: macOS directory name for installed targets.

variable.name: CMAKE_INSTALL_PREFIX

variable.name: CMAKE_INSTALL_PREFIX_INITIALIZED_TO_DEFAULT
variable.desc: CMake sets this variable to a TRUE value when the CMAKE_INSTALL_PREFIX has just been initialized to its default value, typically on the first run of CMake within a new build tree. This can be used by project code to change the default without overriding a user-provided value:

variable.name: CMAKE_Java_VISIBILITY_PRESET
variable.desc: Default value for the <LANG>_VISIBILITY_PRESET target property when a target is created.

variable.name: CMAKE_LIBRARY_ARCHITECTURE
variable.desc: Target architecture library directory name, if detected.

variable.name: CMAKE_LIBRARY_ARCHITECTURE_REGEX
variable.desc: Regex matching possible target architecture library directory names.

variable.name: CMAKE_LIBRARY_OUTPUT_DIRECTORY
variable.desc: Where to put all the LIBRARY target files when built.

variable.name: CMAKE_LIBRARY_OUTPUT_DIRECTORY_<CONFIG>
variable.desc: Where to put all the LIBRARY target files when built for a specific configuration.

variable.name: CMAKE_LIBRARY_PATH
variable.desc: Semicolon-separated list of directories specifying a search path for the find_library() command. By default it is empty, it is intended to be set by the project. See also CMAKE_SYSTEM_LIBRARY_PATH and CMAKE_PREFIX_PATH.

variable.name: CMAKE_LIBRARY_PATH_FLAG
variable.desc: The flag to be used to add a library search path to a compiler.

variable.name: CMAKE_LINK_DEF_FILE_FLAG
variable.desc: Linker flag to be used to specify a .def file for dll creation.

variable.name: CMAKE_LINK_DEPENDS_NO_SHARED
variable.desc: Whether to skip link dependencies on shared library files.

variable.name: CMAKE_LINK_DIRECTORIES_BEFORE
variable.desc: Whether to append or prepend directories by default in link_directories().

variable.name: CMAKE_LINK_INTERFACE_LIBRARIES
variable.desc: Default value for LINK_INTERFACE_LIBRARIES of targets.

variable.name: CMAKE_LINK_LIBRARY_FILE_FLAG
variable.desc: Flag to be used to link a library specified by a path to its file.

variable.name: CMAKE_LINK_LIBRARY_FLAG
variable.desc: Flag to be used to link a library into an executable.

variable.name: CMAKE_LINK_LIBRARY_SUFFIX
variable.desc: The suffix for libraries that you link to.

variable.name: CMAKE_LINK_SEARCH_END_STATIC
variable.desc: End a link line such that static system libraries are used.

variable.name: CMAKE_LINK_SEARCH_START_STATIC
variable.desc: Assume the linker looks for static libraries by default.

variable.name: CMAKE_LINK_WHAT_YOU_USE
variable.desc: Default value for LINK_WHAT_YOU_USE target property. This variable is used to initialize the property on each target as it is created.

variable.name: CMAKE_MACOSX_BUNDLE
variable.desc: Default value for MACOSX_BUNDLE of targets.

variable.name: CMAKE_MACOSX_RPATH
variable.desc: Whether to use rpaths on macOS and iOS.

variable.name: CMAKE_MAJOR_VERSION
variable.desc: First version number component of the CMAKE_VERSION variable.

variable.name: CMAKE_MAKE_PROGRAM
variable.desc: Tool that can launch the native build system. The value may be the full path to an executable or just the tool name if it is expected to be in the PATH.

variable.name: CMAKE_MAP_IMPORTED_CONFIG_<CONFIG>
variable.desc: Default value for MAP_IMPORTED_CONFIG_<CONFIG> of targets.

variable.name: CMAKE_MATCH_<n>
variable.desc: Capture group <n> matched by the last regular expression, for groups 0 through 9. Group 0 is the entire match. Groups 1 through 9 are the subexpressions captured by () syntax.

variable.name: CMAKE_MATCH_COUNT
variable.desc: The number of matches with the last regular expression.

variable.name: CMAKE_MAXIMUM_RECURSION_DEPTH
variable.desc: Maximum recursion depth for CMake scripts. It is intended to be set on the command line with -DCMAKE_MAXIMUM_RECURSION_DEPTH=<x>, or within CMakeLists.txt by projects that require a large recursion depth. Projects that set this variable should provide the user with a way to override it. For example:

variable.name: CMAKE_MESSAGE_CONTEXT
variable.desc: When enabled by the cmake --log-context command line option or the CMAKE_MESSAGE_CONTEXT_SHOW variable, the message() command converts the CMAKE_MESSAGE_CONTEXT list into a dot-separated string surrounded by square brackets and prepends it to each line for messages of log levels NOTICE and below.

variable.name: CMAKE_MESSAGE_CONTEXT_SHOW
variable.desc: Setting this variable to true enables showing a context with each line logged by the message() command (see CMAKE_MESSAGE_CONTEXT for how the context itself is specified).

variable.name: CMAKE_MESSAGE_INDENT
variable.desc: The message() command joins the strings from this list and for log levels of NOTICE and below, it prepends the resultant string to each line of the message.

variable.name: CMAKE_MESSAGE_LOG_LEVEL
variable.desc: When set, this variable specifies the logging level used by the message() command. Valid values are the same as those for the --log-level command line option of the cmake(1) program. If this variable is set and the --log-level command line option is given, the command line option takes precedence.

variable.name: CMAKE_MFC_FLAG
variable.desc: Use the MFC library for an executable or dll.

variable.name: CMAKE_MINIMUM_REQUIRED_VERSION
variable.desc: The <min> version of CMake given to the most recent call to the cmake_minimum_required(VERSION) command.

variable.name: CMAKE_MINOR_VERSION
variable.desc: Second version number component of the CMAKE_VERSION variable.

variable.name: CMAKE_MODULE_LINKER_FLAGS
variable.desc: Linker flags to be used to create modules.

variable.name: CMAKE_MODULE_LINKER_FLAGS_<CONFIG>
variable.desc: Flags to be used when linking a module.

variable.name: CMAKE_MODULE_LINKER_FLAGS_<CONFIG>_INIT
variable.desc: Value used to initialize the CMAKE_MODULE_LINKER_FLAGS_<CONFIG> cache entry the first time a build tree is configured. This variable is meant to be set by a toolchain file. CMake may prepend or append content to the value based on the environment and target platform.

variable.name: CMAKE_MODULE_LINKER_FLAGS_INIT
variable.desc: Value used to initialize the CMAKE_MODULE_LINKER_FLAGS cache entry the first time a build tree is configured. This variable is meant to be set by a toolchain file. CMake may prepend or append content to the value based on the environment and target platform.

variable.name: CMAKE_MODULE_PATH
variable.desc: Semicolon-separated list of directories specifying a search path for CMake modules to be loaded by the include() or find_package() commands before checking the default modules that come with CMake. By default it is empty, it is intended to be set by the project.

variable.name: CMAKE_MSVCIDE_RUN_PATH
variable.desc: Extra PATH locations that should be used when executing add_custom_command() or add_custom_target() when using the Visual Studio 9 2008 (or above) generator. This allows for running commands and using dll’s that the IDE environment is not aware of.

variable.name: CMAKE_MSVC_RUNTIME_LIBRARY
variable.desc: Select the MSVC runtime library for use by compilers targeting the MSVC ABI. This variable is used to initialize the MSVC_RUNTIME_LIBRARY property on all targets as they are created. It is also propagated by calls to the try_compile() command into the test project.

variable.name: CMAKE_NETRC
variable.desc: This variable is used to initialize the NETRC option for file(DOWNLOAD) and file(UPLOAD) commands and the module ExternalProject. See those commands for additional information.

variable.name: CMAKE_NETRC_FILE
variable.desc: This variable is used to initialize the NETRC_FILE option for file(DOWNLOAD) and file(UPLOAD) commands and the module ExternalProject. See those commands for additional information.

variable.name: CMAKE_NINJA_OUTPUT_PATH_PREFIX
variable.desc: Set output files path prefix for the Ninja generator.

variable.name: CMAKE_NOT_USING_CONFIG_FLAGS
variable.desc: Skip _BUILD_TYPE flags if true.

variable.name: CMAKE_NO_BUILTIN_CHRPATH
variable.desc: Do not use the builtin ELF editor to fix RPATHs on installation.

variable.name: CMAKE_NO_SYSTEM_FROM_IMPORTED
variable.desc: Default value for NO_SYSTEM_FROM_IMPORTED of targets.

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJCXX_EXTENSIONS
variable.desc: Default value for OBJCXX_EXTENSIONS property of targets.

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJCXX_STANDARD
variable.desc: Default value for OBJCXX_STANDARD property of targets.

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJCXX_STANDARD_REQUIRED
variable.desc: Default value for OBJCXX_STANDARD_REQUIRED property of targets.

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJC_EXTENSIONS
variable.desc: Default value for OBJC_EXTENSIONS property of targets.

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJC_STANDARD
variable.desc: Default value for OBJC_STANDARD property of targets.

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJC_STANDARD_REQUIRED
variable.desc: Default value for OBJC_STANDARD_REQUIRED property of targets.

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJECT_PATH_MAX
variable.desc: Maximum object file full-path length allowed by native build tools.

variable.name: CMAKE_OSX_ARCHITECTURES
variable.desc: Target specific architectures for macOS and iOS.

variable.name: CMAKE_OSX_DEPLOYMENT_TARGET
variable.desc: Specify the minimum version of the target platform (e.g. macOS or iOS) on which the target binaries are to be deployed. CMake uses this variable value for the -mmacosx-version-min flag or their respective target platform equivalents. For older Xcode versions that shipped multiple macOS SDKs this variable also helps to choose the SDK in case CMAKE_OSX_SYSROOT is unset.

variable.name: CMAKE_OSX_SYSROOT
variable.desc: Specify the location or name of the macOS platform SDK to be used. CMake uses this value to compute the value of the -isysroot flag or equivalent and to help the find_* commands locate files in the SDK.

variable.name: CMAKE_PARENT_LIST_FILE
variable.desc: Full path to the CMake file that included the current one.

variable.name: CMAKE_PATCH_VERSION
variable.desc: Third version number component of the CMAKE_VERSION variable.

variable.name: CMAKE_PCH_WARN_INVALID
variable.desc: This variable is used to initialize the PCH_WARN_INVALID property of targets when they are created.

variable.name: CMAKE_PDB_OUTPUT_DIRECTORY
variable.desc: Output directory for MS debug symbol .pdb files generated by the linker for executable and shared library targets.

variable.name: CMAKE_PDB_OUTPUT_DIRECTORY_<CONFIG>
variable.desc: Per-configuration output directory for MS debug symbol .pdb files generated by the linker for executable and shared library targets.

variable.name: CMAKE_POLICY_DEFAULT_CMP<NNNN>
variable.desc: Default for CMake Policy CMP<NNNN> when it is otherwise left unset.

variable.name: CMAKE_POLICY_WARNING_CMP<NNNN>
variable.desc: Explicitly enable or disable the warning when CMake Policy CMP<NNNN> is not set. This is meaningful only for the few policies that do not warn by default:

variable.name: CMAKE_POSITION_INDEPENDENT_CODE
variable.desc: Default value for POSITION_INDEPENDENT_CODE of targets.

variable.name: CMAKE_PREFIX_PATH
variable.desc: Semicolon-separated list of directories specifying installation prefixes to be searched by the find_package(), find_program(), find_library(), find_file(), and find_path() commands. Each command will add appropriate subdirectories (like bin, lib, or include) as specified in its own documentation.

variable.name: CMAKE_PROGRAM_PATH
variable.desc: Semicolon-separated list of directories specifying a search path for the find_program() command. By default it is empty, it is intended to be set by the project. See also CMAKE_SYSTEM_PROGRAM_PATH and CMAKE_PREFIX_PATH.

variable.name: CMAKE_PROJECT_<PROJECT-NAME>_INCLUDE
variable.desc: A CMake language file or module to be included as the last step of any project() command calls that specify <PROJECT-NAME> as the project name. This is intended for injecting custom code into project builds without modifying their source.

variable.name: CMAKE_PROJECT_<PROJECT-NAME>_INCLUDE_BEFORE
variable.desc: A CMake language file or module to be included as the first step of any project() command calls that specify <PROJECT-NAME> as the project name. This is intended for injecting custom code into project builds without modifying their source.

variable.name: CMAKE_PROJECT_DESCRIPTION
variable.desc: The description of the top level project.

variable.name: CMAKE_PROJECT_HOMEPAGE_URL
variable.desc: The homepage URL of the top level project.

variable.name: CMAKE_PROJECT_INCLUDE
variable.desc: A CMake language file or module to be included as the last step of all project() command calls. This is intended for injecting custom code into project builds without modifying their source.

variable.name: CMAKE_PROJECT_INCLUDE_BEFORE
variable.desc: A CMake language file or module to be included as the first step of all project() command calls. This is intended for injecting custom code into project builds without modifying their source.

variable.name: CMAKE_PROJECT_NAME
variable.desc: The name of the top level project.

variable.name: CMAKE_PROJECT_VERSION
variable.desc: The version of the top level project.

variable.name: CMAKE_PROJECT_VERSION_MAJOR
variable.desc: The major version of the top level project.

variable.name: CMAKE_PROJECT_VERSION_MINOR
variable.desc: The minor version of the top level project.

variable.name: CMAKE_PROJECT_VERSION_PATCH
variable.desc: The patch version of the top level project.

variable.name: CMAKE_PROJECT_VERSION_TWEAK
variable.desc: The tweak version of the top level project.

variable.name: CMAKE_RANLIB
variable.desc: Name of randomizing tool for static libraries.

variable.name: CMAKE_RC_ANDROID_TOOLCHAIN_MACHINE
variable.desc: When Cross Compiling for Android this variable contains the toolchain binutils machine name (e.g. gcc -dumpmachine). The binutils typically have a <machine>- prefix on their name.

variable.name: CMAKE_RC_ANDROID_TOOLCHAIN_PREFIX
variable.desc: When Cross Compiling for Android this variable contains the absolute path prefixing the toolchain GNU compiler and its binutils.

variable.name: CMAKE_RC_ANDROID_TOOLCHAIN_SUFFIX
variable.desc: When Cross Compiling for Android this variable contains the host platform suffix of the toolchain GNU compiler and its binutils.

variable.name: CMAKE_RC_ARCHIVE_APPEND
variable.desc: Rule variable to append to a static archive.

variable.name: CMAKE_RC_ARCHIVE_CREATE
variable.desc: Rule variable to create a new static archive.

variable.name: CMAKE_RC_ARCHIVE_FINISH
variable.desc: Rule variable to finish an existing static archive.

variable.name: CMAKE_RC_CLANG_TIDY
variable.desc: Default value for <LANG>_CLANG_TIDY target property when <LANG> is C or CXX.

variable.name: CMAKE_RC_COMPILER
variable.desc: The full path to the compiler for LANG.

variable.name: CMAKE_RC_COMPILER_ABI
variable.desc: An internal variable subject to change.

variable.name: CMAKE_RC_COMPILER_AR
variable.desc: A wrapper around ar adding the appropriate --plugin option for the compiler.

variable.name: CMAKE_RC_COMPILER_ARCHITECTURE_ID
variable.desc: An internal variable subject to change.

variable.name: CMAKE_RC_COMPILER_EXTERNAL_TOOLCHAIN
variable.desc: The external toolchain for cross-compiling, if supported.

variable.name: CMAKE_RC_COMPILER_ID
variable.desc: Compiler identification string.

variable.name: CMAKE_RC_COMPILER_LAUNCHER
variable.desc: Default value for <LANG>_COMPILER_LAUNCHER target property. This variable is used to initialize the property on each target as it is created. This is done only when <LANG> is C, CXX, Fortran, OBJC, OBJCXX, or CUDA.

variable.name: CMAKE_RC_COMPILER_LOADED
variable.desc: Defined to true if the language is enabled.

variable.name: CMAKE_RC_COMPILER_PREDEFINES_COMMAND
variable.desc: Command that outputs the compiler pre definitions.

variable.name: CMAKE_RC_COMPILER_RANLIB
variable.desc: A wrapper around ranlib adding the appropriate --plugin option for the compiler.

variable.name: CMAKE_RC_COMPILER_TARGET
variable.desc: The target for cross-compiling, if supported.

variable.name: CMAKE_RC_COMPILER_VERSION
variable.desc: Compiler version string.

variable.name: CMAKE_RC_COMPILER_VERSION_INTERNAL
variable.desc: An internal variable subject to change.

variable.name: CMAKE_RC_COMPILE_OBJECT
variable.desc: Rule variable to compile a single object file.

variable.name: CMAKE_RC_CPPCHECK
variable.desc: Default value for <LANG>_CPPCHECK target property. This variable is used to initialize the property on each target as it is created. This is done only when <LANG> is C or CXX.

variable.name: CMAKE_RC_CPPLINT
variable.desc: Default value for <LANG>_CPPLINT target property. This variable is used to initialize the property on each target as it is created. This is done only when <LANG> is C or CXX.

variable.name: CMAKE_RC_CREATE_SHARED_LIBRARY
variable.desc: Rule variable to create a shared library.

variable.name: CMAKE_RC_CREATE_SHARED_MODULE
variable.desc: Rule variable to create a shared module.

variable.name: CMAKE_RC_CREATE_STATIC_LIBRARY
variable.desc: Rule variable to create a static library.

variable.name: CMAKE_RC_FLAGS
variable.desc: Flags for all build types.

variable.name: CMAKE_RC_FLAGS
variable.desc: Flags for language <LANG> when building for the <CONFIG> configuration.

variable.name: CMAKE_RC_FLAGS
variable.desc: Value used to initialize the CMAKE_<LANG>_FLAGS_<CONFIG> cache entry the first time a build tree is configured for language <LANG>. This variable is meant to be set by a toolchain file. CMake may prepend or append content to the value based on the environment and target platform.

variable.name: CMAKE_RC_FLAGS_DEBUG
variable.desc: This variable is the Debug variant of the CMAKE_<LANG>_FLAGS_<CONFIG> variable.

variable.name: CMAKE_RC_FLAGS_DEBUG_INIT
variable.desc: This variable is the Debug variant of the CMAKE_<LANG>_FLAGS_<CONFIG>_INIT variable.

variable.name: CMAKE_RC_FLAGS_INIT
variable.desc: Value used to initialize the CMAKE_<LANG>_FLAGS cache entry the first time a build tree is configured for language <LANG>. This variable is meant to be set by a toolchain file. CMake may prepend or append content to the value based on the environment and target platform. For example, the contents of a xxxFLAGS environment variable will be prepended, where xxx will be language-specific but not necessarily the same as <LANG> (e.g. CXXFLAGS for CXX, FFLAGS for Fortran, and so on).

variable.name: CMAKE_RC_FLAGS_MINSIZEREL
variable.desc: This variable is the MinSizeRel variant of the CMAKE_<LANG>_FLAGS_<CONFIG> variable.

variable.name: CMAKE_RC_FLAGS_MINSIZEREL_INIT
variable.desc: This variable is the MinSizeRel variant of the CMAKE_<LANG>_FLAGS_<CONFIG>_INIT variable.

variable.name: CMAKE_RC_FLAGS_RELEASE
variable.desc: This variable is the Release variant of the CMAKE_<LANG>_FLAGS_<CONFIG> variable.

variable.name: CMAKE_RC_FLAGS_RELEASE_INIT
variable.desc: This variable is the Release variant of the CMAKE_<LANG>_FLAGS_<CONFIG>_INIT variable.

variable.name: CMAKE_RC_FLAGS_RELWITHDEBINFO
variable.desc: This variable is the RelWithDebInfo variant of the CMAKE_<LANG>_FLAGS_<CONFIG> variable.

variable.name: CMAKE_RC_FLAGS_RELWITHDEBINFO_INIT
variable.desc: This variable is the RelWithDebInfo variant of the CMAKE_<LANG>_FLAGS_<CONFIG>_INIT variable.

variable.name: CMAKE_RC_IGNORE_EXTENSIONS
variable.desc: File extensions that should be ignored by the build.

variable.name: CMAKE_RC_IMPLICIT_INCLUDE_DIRECTORIES
variable.desc: Directories implicitly searched by the compiler for header files.

variable.name: CMAKE_RC_IMPLICIT_LINK_DIRECTORIES
variable.desc: Implicit linker search path detected for language <LANG>.

variable.name: CMAKE_RC_IMPLICIT_LINK_FRAMEWORK_DIRECTORIES
variable.desc: Implicit linker framework search path detected for language <LANG>.

variable.name: CMAKE_RC_IMPLICIT_LINK_LIBRARIES
variable.desc: Implicit link libraries and flags detected for language <LANG>.

variable.name: CMAKE_RC_INCLUDE_WHAT_YOU_USE
variable.desc: Default value for <LANG>_INCLUDE_WHAT_YOU_USE target property. This variable is used to initialize the property on each target as it is created. This is done only when <LANG> is C or CXX.

variable.name: CMAKE_RC_LIBRARY_ARCHITECTURE
variable.desc: Target architecture library directory name detected for <LANG>.

variable.name: CMAKE_RC_LINKER_PREFERENCE
variable.desc: Preference value for linker language selection.

variable.name: CMAKE_RC_LINKER_PREFERENCE_PROPAGATES
variable.desc: True if CMAKE_<LANG>_LINKER_PREFERENCE propagates across targets.

variable.name: CMAKE_RC_LINKER_WRAPPER_FLAG
variable.desc: Defines the syntax of compiler driver option to pass options to the linker tool. It will be used to translate the LINKER: prefix in the link options (see add_link_options() and target_link_options()).

variable.name: CMAKE_RC_LINKER_WRAPPER_FLAG_SEP
variable.desc: This variable is used with CMAKE_<LANG>_LINKER_WRAPPER_FLAG variable to format LINKER: prefix in the link options (see add_link_options() and target_link_options()).

variable.name: CMAKE_RC_LINK_EXECUTABLE
variable.desc: Rule variable to link an executable.

variable.name: CMAKE_RC_LINK_LIBRARY_FILE_FLAG
variable.desc: Language-specific flag to be used to link a library specified by a path to its file.

variable.name: CMAKE_RC_LINK_LIBRARY_FLAG
variable.desc: Flag to be used to link a library into a shared library or executable.

variable.name: CMAKE_RC_LINK_LIBRARY_SUFFIX
variable.desc: Language-specific suffix for libraries that you link to.

variable.name: CMAKE_RC_OUTPUT_EXTENSION
variable.desc: Extension for the output of a compile for a single file.

variable.name: CMAKE_RC_PLATFORM_ID
variable.desc: An internal variable subject to change.

variable.name: CMAKE_RC_SIMULATE_ID
variable.desc: Identification string of “simulated” compiler.

variable.name: CMAKE_RC_SIMULATE_VERSION
variable.desc: Version string of “simulated” compiler.

variable.name: CMAKE_RC_SIZEOF_DATA_PTR
variable.desc: Size of pointer-to-data types for language <LANG>.

variable.name: CMAKE_RC_SOURCE_FILE_EXTENSIONS
variable.desc: Extensions of source files for the given language.

variable.name: CMAKE_RC_STANDARD_INCLUDE_DIRECTORIES
variable.desc: Include directories to be used for every source file compiled with the <LANG> compiler. This is meant for specification of system include directories needed by the language for the current platform. The directories always appear at the end of the include path passed to the compiler.

variable.name: CMAKE_RC_STANDARD_LIBRARIES
variable.desc: Libraries linked into every executable and shared library linked for language <LANG>. This is meant for specification of system libraries needed by the language for the current platform.

variable.name: CMAKE_RC_VISIBILITY_PRESET
variable.desc: Default value for the <LANG>_VISIBILITY_PRESET target property when a target is created.

variable.name: CMAKE_ROOT
variable.desc: Install directory for running cmake.

variable.name: CMAKE_RULE_MESSAGES
variable.desc: Specify whether to report a message for each make rule.

variable.name: CMAKE_RUNTIME_OUTPUT_DIRECTORY
variable.desc: Where to put all the RUNTIME target files when built.

variable.name: CMAKE_RUNTIME_OUTPUT_DIRECTORY_<CONFIG>
variable.desc: Where to put all the RUNTIME target files when built for a specific configuration.

variable.name: CMAKE_SCRIPT_MODE_FILE
variable.desc: Full path to the cmake(1) -P script file currently being processed.

variable.name: CMAKE_SHARED_LIBRARY_PREFIX
variable.desc: The prefix for shared libraries that you link to.

variable.name: CMAKE_SHARED_LIBRARY_SUFFIX
variable.desc: The suffix for shared libraries that you link to.

variable.name: CMAKE_SHARED_LINKER_FLAGS
variable.desc: Linker flags to be used to create shared libraries.

variable.name: CMAKE_SHARED_LINKER_FLAGS_<CONFIG>
variable.desc: Flags to be used when linking a shared library.

variable.name: CMAKE_SHARED_LINKER_FLAGS_<CONFIG>_INIT
variable.desc: Value used to initialize the CMAKE_SHARED_LINKER_FLAGS_<CONFIG> cache entry the first time a build tree is configured. This variable is meant to be set by a toolchain file. CMake may prepend or append content to the value based on the environment and target platform.

variable.name: CMAKE_SHARED_LINKER_FLAGS_INIT
variable.desc: Value used to initialize the CMAKE_SHARED_LINKER_FLAGS cache entry the first time a build tree is configured. This variable is meant to be set by a toolchain file. CMake may prepend or append content to the value based on the environment and target platform.

variable.name: CMAKE_SHARED_MODULE_PREFIX
variable.desc: The prefix for loadable modules that you link to.

variable.name: CMAKE_SHARED_MODULE_SUFFIX
variable.desc: The suffix for shared libraries that you link to.

variable.name: CMAKE_SIZEOF_VOID_P
variable.desc: Size of a void pointer.

variable.name: CMAKE_SKIP_BUILD_RPATH
variable.desc: Do not include RPATHs in the build tree.

variable.name: CMAKE_SKIP_INSTALL_ALL_DEPENDENCY
variable.desc: Don’t make the install target depend on the all target.

variable.name: CMAKE_SKIP_INSTALL_RPATH
variable.desc: Do not include RPATHs in the install tree.

variable.name: CMAKE_SKIP_INSTALL_RULES
variable.desc: Whether to disable generation of installation rules.

variable.name: CMAKE_SKIP_RPATH
variable.desc: If true, do not add run time path information.

variable.name: CMAKE_SOURCE_DIR
variable.desc: The path to the top level of the source tree.

variable.name: CMAKE_STAGING_PREFIX
variable.desc: This variable may be set to a path to install to when cross-compiling. This can be useful if the path in CMAKE_SYSROOT is read-only, or otherwise should remain pristine.

variable.name: CMAKE_STATIC_LIBRARY_PREFIX
variable.desc: The prefix for static libraries that you link to.

variable.name: CMAKE_STATIC_LIBRARY_SUFFIX
variable.desc: The suffix for static libraries that you link to.

variable.name: CMAKE_STATIC_LINKER_FLAGS
variable.desc: Flags to be used to create static libraries. These flags will be passed to the archiver when creating a static library.

variable.name: CMAKE_STATIC_LINKER_FLAGS_<CONFIG>
variable.desc: Flags to be used to create static libraries. These flags will be passed to the archiver when creating a static library in the <CONFIG> configuration.

variable.name: CMAKE_STATIC_LINKER_FLAGS_<CONFIG>_INIT
variable.desc: Value used to initialize the CMAKE_STATIC_LINKER_FLAGS_<CONFIG> cache entry the first time a build tree is configured. This variable is meant to be set by a toolchain file. CMake may prepend or append content to the value based on the environment and target platform.

variable.name: CMAKE_STATIC_LINKER_FLAGS_INIT
variable.desc: Value used to initialize the CMAKE_STATIC_LINKER_FLAGS cache entry the first time a build tree is configured. This variable is meant to be set by a toolchain file. CMake may prepend or append content to the value based on the environment and target platform.

variable.name: CMAKE_SUBLIME_TEXT_2_ENV_SETTINGS
variable.desc: This variable contains a list of env vars as a list of tokens with the syntax var=value.

variable.name: CMAKE_SUBLIME_TEXT_2_EXCLUDE_BUILD_TREE
variable.desc: If this variable evaluates to ON at the end of the top-level CMakeLists.txt file, the Sublime Text 2 extra generator excludes the build tree from the .sublime-project if it is inside the source tree.

variable.name: CMAKE_SUPPRESS_REGENERATION
variable.desc: If CMAKE_SUPPRESS_REGENERATION is OFF, which is default, then CMake adds a special target on which all other targets depend that checks the build system and optionally re-runs CMake to regenerate the build system when the target specification source changes.

variable.name: CMAKE_SYSROOT
variable.desc: Path to pass to the compiler in the --sysroot flag.

variable.name: CMAKE_SYSROOT_COMPILE
variable.desc: Path to pass to the compiler in the --sysroot flag when compiling source files. This is the same as CMAKE_SYSROOT but is used only for compiling sources and not linking.

variable.name: CMAKE_SYSROOT_LINK
variable.desc: Path to pass to the compiler in the --sysroot flag when linking. This is the same as CMAKE_SYSROOT but is used only for linking and not compiling sources.

variable.name: CMAKE_SYSTEM
variable.desc: Composite name of operating system CMake is compiling for.

variable.name: CMAKE_SYSTEM_APPBUNDLE_PATH
variable.desc: Search path for macOS application bundles used by the find_program(), and find_package() commands. By default it contains the standard directories for the current system. It is not intended to be modified by the project, use CMAKE_APPBUNDLE_PATH for this.

variable.name: CMAKE_SYSTEM_FRAMEWORK_PATH
variable.desc: Search path for macOS frameworks used by the find_library(), find_package(), find_path(), and find_file() commands. By default it contains the standard directories for the current system. It is not intended to be modified by the project, use CMAKE_FRAMEWORK_PATH for this.

variable.name: CMAKE_SYSTEM_IGNORE_PATH
variable.desc: Semicolon-separated list of directories to be ignored by the find_program(), find_library(), find_file(), and find_path() commands. This is useful in cross-compiling environments where some system directories contain incompatible but possibly linkable libraries. For example, on cross-compiled cluster environments, this allows a user to ignore directories containing libraries meant for the front-end machine.

variable.name: CMAKE_SYSTEM_INCLUDE_PATH
variable.desc: Semicolon-separated list of directories specifying a search path for the find_file() and find_path() commands. By default this contains the standard directories for the current system. It is not intended to be modified by the project; use CMAKE_INCLUDE_PATH for this. See also CMAKE_SYSTEM_PREFIX_PATH.

variable.name: CMAKE_SYSTEM_LIBRARY_PATH
variable.desc: Semicolon-separated list of directories specifying a search path for the find_library() command. By default this contains the standard directories for the current system. It is not intended to be modified by the project; use CMAKE_LIBRARY_PATH for this. See also CMAKE_SYSTEM_PREFIX_PATH.

variable.name: CMAKE_SYSTEM_NAME
variable.desc: The name of the operating system for which CMake is to build. See the CMAKE_SYSTEM_VERSION variable for the OS version.

variable.name: CMAKE_SYSTEM_PREFIX_PATH
variable.desc: Semicolon-separated list of directories specifying installation prefixes to be searched by the find_package(), find_program(), find_library(), find_file(), and find_path() commands. Each command will add appropriate subdirectories (like bin, lib, or include) as specified in its own documentation.

variable.name: CMAKE_SYSTEM_PROCESSOR
variable.desc: The name of the CPU CMake is building for.

variable.name: CMAKE_SYSTEM_PROGRAM_PATH
variable.desc: Semicolon-separated list of directories specifying a search path for the find_program() command. By default this contains the standard directories for the current system. It is not intended to be modified by the project; use CMAKE_PROGRAM_PATH for this. See also CMAKE_SYSTEM_PREFIX_PATH.

variable.name: CMAKE_SYSTEM_VERSION
variable.desc: The version of the operating system for which CMake is to build. See the CMAKE_SYSTEM_NAME variable for the OS name.

variable.name: CMAKE_Swift_ANDROID_TOOLCHAIN_MACHINE
variable.desc: When Cross Compiling for Android this variable contains the toolchain binutils machine name (e.g. gcc -dumpmachine). The binutils typically have a <machine>- prefix on their name.

variable.name: CMAKE_Swift_ANDROID_TOOLCHAIN_PREFIX
variable.desc: When Cross Compiling for Android this variable contains the absolute path prefixing the toolchain GNU compiler and its binutils.

variable.name: CMAKE_Swift_ANDROID_TOOLCHAIN_SUFFIX
variable.desc: When Cross Compiling for Android this variable contains the host platform suffix of the toolchain GNU compiler and its binutils.

variable.name: CMAKE_Swift_ARCHIVE_APPEND
variable.desc: Rule variable to append to a static archive.

variable.name: CMAKE_Swift_ARCHIVE_CREATE
variable.desc: Rule variable to create a new static archive.

variable.name: CMAKE_Swift_ARCHIVE_FINISH
variable.desc: Rule variable to finish an existing static archive.

variable.name: CMAKE_Swift_CLANG_TIDY
variable.desc: Default value for <LANG>_CLANG_TIDY target property when <LANG> is C or CXX.

variable.name: CMAKE_Swift_COMPILER
variable.desc: The full path to the compiler for LANG.

variable.name: CMAKE_Swift_COMPILER_ABI
variable.desc: An internal variable subject to change.

variable.name: CMAKE_Swift_COMPILER_AR
variable.desc: A wrapper around ar adding the appropriate --plugin option for the compiler.

variable.name: CMAKE_Swift_COMPILER_ARCHITECTURE_ID
variable.desc: An internal variable subject to change.

variable.name: CMAKE_Swift_COMPILER_EXTERNAL_TOOLCHAIN
variable.desc: The external toolchain for cross-compiling, if supported.

variable.name: CMAKE_Swift_COMPILER_ID
variable.desc: Compiler identification string.

variable.name: CMAKE_Swift_COMPILER_LAUNCHER
variable.desc: Default value for <LANG>_COMPILER_LAUNCHER target property. This variable is used to initialize the property on each target as it is created. This is done only when <LANG> is C, CXX, Fortran, OBJC, OBJCXX, or CUDA.

variable.name: CMAKE_Swift_COMPILER_LOADED
variable.desc: Defined to true if the language is enabled.

variable.name: CMAKE_Swift_COMPILER_PREDEFINES_COMMAND
variable.desc: Command that outputs the compiler pre definitions.

variable.name: CMAKE_Swift_COMPILER_RANLIB
variable.desc: A wrapper around ranlib adding the appropriate --plugin option for the compiler.

variable.name: CMAKE_Swift_COMPILER_TARGET
variable.desc: The target for cross-compiling, if supported.

variable.name: CMAKE_Swift_COMPILER_VERSION
variable.desc: Compiler version string.

variable.name: CMAKE_Swift_COMPILER_VERSION_INTERNAL
variable.desc: An internal variable subject to change.

variable.name: CMAKE_Swift_COMPILE_OBJECT
variable.desc: Rule variable to compile a single object file.

variable.name: CMAKE_Swift_CPPCHECK
variable.desc: Default value for <LANG>_CPPCHECK target property. This variable is used to initialize the property on each target as it is created. This is done only when <LANG> is C or CXX.

variable.name: CMAKE_Swift_CPPLINT
variable.desc: Default value for <LANG>_CPPLINT target property. This variable is used to initialize the property on each target as it is created. This is done only when <LANG> is C or CXX.

variable.name: CMAKE_Swift_CREATE_SHARED_LIBRARY
variable.desc: Rule variable to create a shared library.

variable.name: CMAKE_Swift_CREATE_SHARED_MODULE
variable.desc: Rule variable to create a shared module.

variable.name: CMAKE_Swift_CREATE_STATIC_LIBRARY
variable.desc: Rule variable to create a static library.

variable.name: CMAKE_Swift_FLAGS
variable.desc: Flags for all build types.

variable.name: CMAKE_Swift_FLAGS
variable.desc: Flags for language <LANG> when building for the <CONFIG> configuration.

variable.name: CMAKE_Swift_FLAGS
variable.desc: Value used to initialize the CMAKE_<LANG>_FLAGS_<CONFIG> cache entry the first time a build tree is configured for language <LANG>. This variable is meant to be set by a toolchain file. CMake may prepend or append content to the value based on the environment and target platform.

variable.name: CMAKE_Swift_FLAGS_DEBUG
variable.desc: This variable is the Debug variant of the CMAKE_<LANG>_FLAGS_<CONFIG> variable.

variable.name: CMAKE_Swift_FLAGS_DEBUG_INIT
variable.desc: This variable is the Debug variant of the CMAKE_<LANG>_FLAGS_<CONFIG>_INIT variable.

variable.name: CMAKE_Swift_FLAGS_INIT
variable.desc: Value used to initialize the CMAKE_<LANG>_FLAGS cache entry the first time a build tree is configured for language <LANG>. This variable is meant to be set by a toolchain file. CMake may prepend or append content to the value based on the environment and target platform. For example, the contents of a xxxFLAGS environment variable will be prepended, where xxx will be language-specific but not necessarily the same as <LANG> (e.g. CXXFLAGS for CXX, FFLAGS for Fortran, and so on).

variable.name: CMAKE_Swift_FLAGS_MINSIZEREL
variable.desc: This variable is the MinSizeRel variant of the CMAKE_<LANG>_FLAGS_<CONFIG> variable.

variable.name: CMAKE_Swift_FLAGS_MINSIZEREL_INIT
variable.desc: This variable is the MinSizeRel variant of the CMAKE_<LANG>_FLAGS_<CONFIG>_INIT variable.

variable.name: CMAKE_Swift_FLAGS_RELEASE
variable.desc: This variable is the Release variant of the CMAKE_<LANG>_FLAGS_<CONFIG> variable.

variable.name: CMAKE_Swift_FLAGS_RELEASE_INIT
variable.desc: This variable is the Release variant of the CMAKE_<LANG>_FLAGS_<CONFIG>_INIT variable.

variable.name: CMAKE_Swift_FLAGS_RELWITHDEBINFO
variable.desc: This variable is the RelWithDebInfo variant of the CMAKE_<LANG>_FLAGS_<CONFIG> variable.

variable.name: CMAKE_Swift_FLAGS_RELWITHDEBINFO_INIT
variable.desc: This variable is the RelWithDebInfo variant of the CMAKE_<LANG>_FLAGS_<CONFIG>_INIT variable.

variable.name: CMAKE_Swift_IGNORE_EXTENSIONS
variable.desc: File extensions that should be ignored by the build.

variable.name: CMAKE_Swift_IMPLICIT_INCLUDE_DIRECTORIES
variable.desc: Directories implicitly searched by the compiler for header files.

variable.name: CMAKE_Swift_IMPLICIT_LINK_DIRECTORIES
variable.desc: Implicit linker search path detected for language <LANG>.

variable.name: CMAKE_Swift_IMPLICIT_LINK_FRAMEWORK_DIRECTORIES
variable.desc: Implicit linker framework search path detected for language <LANG>.

variable.name: CMAKE_Swift_IMPLICIT_LINK_LIBRARIES
variable.desc: Implicit link libraries and flags detected for language <LANG>.

variable.name: CMAKE_Swift_INCLUDE_WHAT_YOU_USE
variable.desc: Default value for <LANG>_INCLUDE_WHAT_YOU_USE target property. This variable is used to initialize the property on each target as it is created. This is done only when <LANG> is C or CXX.

variable.name: CMAKE_Swift_LANGUAGE_VERSION
variable.desc: Set to the Swift language version number. If not set, the oldest legacy version known to be available in the host Xcode version is assumed:

variable.name: CMAKE_Swift_LIBRARY_ARCHITECTURE
variable.desc: Target architecture library directory name detected for <LANG>.

variable.name: CMAKE_Swift_LINKER_PREFERENCE
variable.desc: Preference value for linker language selection.

variable.name: CMAKE_Swift_LINKER_PREFERENCE_PROPAGATES
variable.desc: True if CMAKE_<LANG>_LINKER_PREFERENCE propagates across targets.

variable.name: CMAKE_Swift_LINKER_WRAPPER_FLAG
variable.desc: Defines the syntax of compiler driver option to pass options to the linker tool. It will be used to translate the LINKER: prefix in the link options (see add_link_options() and target_link_options()).

variable.name: CMAKE_Swift_LINKER_WRAPPER_FLAG_SEP
variable.desc: This variable is used with CMAKE_<LANG>_LINKER_WRAPPER_FLAG variable to format LINKER: prefix in the link options (see add_link_options() and target_link_options()).

variable.name: CMAKE_Swift_LINK_EXECUTABLE
variable.desc: Rule variable to link an executable.

variable.name: CMAKE_Swift_LINK_LIBRARY_FILE_FLAG
variable.desc: Language-specific flag to be used to link a library specified by a path to its file.

variable.name: CMAKE_Swift_LINK_LIBRARY_FLAG
variable.desc: Flag to be used to link a library into a shared library or executable.

variable.name: CMAKE_Swift_LINK_LIBRARY_SUFFIX
variable.desc: Language-specific suffix for libraries that you link to.

variable.name: CMAKE_Swift_MODULE_DIRECTORY
variable.desc: Swift module output directory.

variable.name: CMAKE_Swift_NUM_THREADS
variable.desc: Number of threads for parallel compilation for Swift targets.

variable.name: CMAKE_Swift_OUTPUT_EXTENSION
variable.desc: Extension for the output of a compile for a single file.

variable.name: CMAKE_Swift_PLATFORM_ID
variable.desc: An internal variable subject to change.

variable.name: CMAKE_Swift_SIMULATE_ID
variable.desc: Identification string of “simulated” compiler.

variable.name: CMAKE_Swift_SIMULATE_VERSION
variable.desc: Version string of “simulated” compiler.

variable.name: CMAKE_Swift_SIZEOF_DATA_PTR
variable.desc: Size of pointer-to-data types for language <LANG>.

variable.name: CMAKE_Swift_SOURCE_FILE_EXTENSIONS
variable.desc: Extensions of source files for the given language.

variable.name: CMAKE_Swift_STANDARD_INCLUDE_DIRECTORIES
variable.desc: Include directories to be used for every source file compiled with the <LANG> compiler. This is meant for specification of system include directories needed by the language for the current platform. The directories always appear at the end of the include path passed to the compiler.

variable.name: CMAKE_Swift_STANDARD_LIBRARIES
variable.desc: Libraries linked into every executable and shared library linked for language <LANG>. This is meant for specification of system libraries needed by the language for the current platform.

variable.name: CMAKE_Swift_VISIBILITY_PRESET
variable.desc: Default value for the <LANG>_VISIBILITY_PRESET target property when a target is created.

variable.name: CMAKE_TOOLCHAIN_FILE
variable.desc: Path to toolchain file supplied to cmake(1).

variable.name: CMAKE_TRY_COMPILE_CONFIGURATION
variable.desc: Build configuration used for try_compile() and try_run() projects.

variable.name: CMAKE_TRY_COMPILE_PLATFORM_VARIABLES
variable.desc: List of variables that the try_compile() command source file signature must propagate into the test project in order to target the same platform as the host project.

variable.name: CMAKE_TRY_COMPILE_TARGET_TYPE
variable.desc: Type of target generated for try_compile() calls using the source file signature. Valid values are:

variable.name: CMAKE_TWEAK_VERSION
variable.desc: Defined to 0 for compatibility with code written for older CMake versions that may have defined higher values.

variable.name: CMAKE_UNITY_BUILD
variable.desc: This variable is used to initialize the UNITY_BUILD property of targets when they are created. Setting it to true enables batch compilation of multiple sources within each target. This feature is known as a Unity or Jumbo build.

variable.name: CMAKE_UNITY_BUILD_BATCH_SIZE
variable.desc: This variable is used to initialize the UNITY_BUILD_BATCH_SIZE property of targets when they are created. It specifies the default upper limit on the number of source files that may be combined in any one unity source file when unity builds are enabled for a target.

variable.name: CMAKE_USER_MAKE_RULES_OVERRIDE
variable.desc: Specify a CMake file that overrides platform information.

variable.name: CMAKE_USER_MAKE_RULES_OVERRIDE_<LANG>
variable.desc: Specify a CMake file that overrides platform information for <LANG>.

variable.name: CMAKE_USE_RELATIVE_PATHS
variable.desc: This variable has no effect. The partially implemented effect it had in previous releases was removed in CMake 3.4.

variable.name: CMAKE_VERBOSE_MAKEFILE
variable.desc: Enable verbose output from Makefile builds.

variable.name: CMAKE_VERSION
variable.desc: The CMake version string as three non-negative integer components separated by . and possibly followed by - and other information. The first two components represent the feature level and the third component represents either a bug-fix level or development date.

variable.name: CMAKE_VISIBILITY_INLINES_HIDDEN
variable.desc: Default value for the VISIBILITY_INLINES_HIDDEN target property when a target is created.

variable.name: CMAKE_VS_DEVENV_COMMAND
variable.desc: The generators for Visual Studio 9 2008 and above set this variable to the devenv.com command installed with the corresponding Visual Studio version. Note that this variable may be empty on Visual Studio Express editions because they do not provide this tool.

variable.name: CMAKE_VS_GLOBALS
variable.desc: List of Key=Value records to be set per target as target properties VS_GLOBAL_<variable> with variable=Key and value Value.

variable.name: CMAKE_VS_INCLUDE_INSTALL_TO_DEFAULT_BUILD
variable.desc: Include INSTALL target to default build.

variable.name: CMAKE_VS_INCLUDE_PACKAGE_TO_DEFAULT_BUILD
variable.desc: Include PACKAGE target to default build.

variable.name: CMAKE_VS_INTEL_Fortran_PROJECT_VERSION
variable.desc: When generating for Visual Studio 9 2008 or greater with the Intel Fortran plugin installed, this specifies the .vfproj project file format version. This is intended for internal use by CMake and should not be used by project code.

variable.name: CMAKE_VS_JUST_MY_CODE_DEBUGGING
variable.desc: Enable Just My Code with Visual Studio debugger.

variable.name: CMAKE_VS_MSBUILD_COMMAND
variable.desc: The generators for Visual Studio 10 2010 and above set this variable to the MSBuild.exe command installed with the corresponding Visual Studio version.

variable.name: CMAKE_VS_NsightTegra_VERSION
variable.desc: When using a Visual Studio generator with the CMAKE_SYSTEM_NAME variable set to Android, this variable contains the version number of the installed NVIDIA Nsight Tegra Visual Studio Edition.

variable.name: CMAKE_VS_PLATFORM_NAME
variable.desc: Visual Studio target platform name used by the current generator.

variable.name: CMAKE_VS_PLATFORM_NAME_DEFAULT
variable.desc: Default for the Visual Studio target platform name for the current generator without considering the value of the CMAKE_GENERATOR_PLATFORM variable. For Visual Studio Generators for VS 2017 and below this is always Win32. For VS 2019 and above this is based on the host platform.

variable.name: CMAKE_VS_PLATFORM_TOOLSET
variable.desc: Visual Studio Platform Toolset name.

variable.name: CMAKE_VS_PLATFORM_TOOLSET_CUDA
variable.desc: NVIDIA CUDA Toolkit version whose Visual Studio toolset to use.

variable.name: CMAKE_VS_PLATFORM_TOOLSET_CUDA_CUSTOM_DIR
variable.desc: Path to standalone NVIDIA CUDA Toolkit (eg. extracted from installer).

variable.name: CMAKE_VS_PLATFORM_TOOLSET_HOST_ARCHITECTURE
variable.desc: Visual Studio preferred tool architecture.

variable.name: CMAKE_VS_PLATFORM_TOOLSET_VERSION
variable.desc: Visual Studio Platform Toolset version.

variable.name: CMAKE_VS_SDK_EXCLUDE_DIRECTORIES
variable.desc: This variable allows to override Visual Studio default Exclude Directories.

variable.name: CMAKE_VS_SDK_EXECUTABLE_DIRECTORIES
variable.desc: This variable allows to override Visual Studio default Executable Directories.

variable.name: CMAKE_VS_SDK_INCLUDE_DIRECTORIES
variable.desc: This variable allows to override Visual Studio default Include Directories.

variable.name: CMAKE_VS_SDK_LIBRARY_DIRECTORIES
variable.desc: This variable allows to override Visual Studio default Library Directories.

variable.name: CMAKE_VS_SDK_LIBRARY_WINRT_DIRECTORIES
variable.desc: This variable allows to override Visual Studio default Library WinRT Directories.

variable.name: CMAKE_VS_SDK_REFERENCE_DIRECTORIES
variable.desc: This variable allows to override Visual Studio default Reference Directories.

variable.name: CMAKE_VS_SDK_SOURCE_DIRECTORIES
variable.desc: This variable allows to override Visual Studio default Source Directories.

variable.name: CMAKE_VS_WINDOWS_TARGET_PLATFORM_VERSION
variable.desc: Visual Studio Windows Target Platform Version.

variable.name: CMAKE_VS_WINRT_BY_DEFAULT
variable.desc: Inform Visual Studio Generators for VS 2010 and above that the target platform enables WinRT compilation by default and it needs to be explicitly disabled if /ZW or VS_WINRT_COMPONENT is omitted (as opposed to enabling it when either of those options is present)

variable.name: CMAKE_WARN_DEPRECATED
variable.desc: Whether to issue warnings for deprecated functionality.

variable.name: CMAKE_WARN_ON_ABSOLUTE_INSTALL_DESTINATION
variable.desc: Ask cmake_install.cmake script to warn each time a file with absolute INSTALL DESTINATION is encountered.

variable.name: CMAKE_WIN32_EXECUTABLE
variable.desc: Default value for WIN32_EXECUTABLE of targets.

variable.name: CMAKE_WINDOWS_EXPORT_ALL_SYMBOLS
variable.desc: Default value for WINDOWS_EXPORT_ALL_SYMBOLS target property. This variable is used to initialize the property on each target as it is created.

variable.name: CMAKE_XCODE_ATTRIBUTE_<an-attribute>
variable.desc: Set Xcode target attributes directly.

variable.name: CMAKE_XCODE_GENERATE_SCHEME
variable.desc: If enabled, the Xcode generator will generate schema files. These are useful to invoke analyze, archive, build-for-testing and test actions from the command line.

variable.name: CMAKE_XCODE_GENERATE_TOP_LEVEL_PROJECT_ONLY
variable.desc: If enabled, the Xcode generator will generate only a single Xcode project file for the topmost project() command instead of generating one for every project() command.

variable.name: CMAKE_XCODE_PLATFORM_TOOLSET
variable.desc: Xcode compiler selection.

variable.name: CMAKE_XCODE_SCHEME_ADDRESS_SANITIZER
variable.desc: Whether to enable Address Sanitizer in the Diagnostics section of the generated Xcode scheme.

variable.name: CMAKE_XCODE_SCHEME_ADDRESS_SANITIZER_USE_AFTER_RETURN
variable.desc: Whether to enable Detect use of stack after return in the Diagnostics section of the generated Xcode scheme.

variable.name: CMAKE_XCODE_SCHEME_DEBUG_DOCUMENT_VERSIONING
variable.desc: Whether to enable Allow debugging when using document Versions Browser in the Options section of the generated Xcode scheme.

variable.name: CMAKE_XCODE_SCHEME_DISABLE_MAIN_THREAD_CHECKER
variable.desc: Whether to disable the Main Thread Checker in the Diagnostics section of the generated Xcode scheme.

variable.name: CMAKE_XCODE_SCHEME_DYNAMIC_LIBRARY_LOADS
variable.desc: Whether to enable Dynamic Library Loads in the Diagnostics section of the generated Xcode scheme.

variable.name: CMAKE_XCODE_SCHEME_DYNAMIC_LINKER_API_USAGE
variable.desc: Whether to enable Dynamic Linker API usage in the Diagnostics section of the generated Xcode scheme.

variable.name: CMAKE_XCODE_SCHEME_ENVIRONMENT
variable.desc: Specify environment variables that should be added to the Arguments section of the generated Xcode scheme.

variable.name: CMAKE_XCODE_SCHEME_GUARD_MALLOC
variable.desc: Whether to enable Guard Malloc in the Diagnostics section of the generated Xcode scheme.

variable.name: CMAKE_XCODE_SCHEME_MAIN_THREAD_CHECKER_STOP
variable.desc: Whether to enable the Main Thread Checker option Pause on issues in the Diagnostics section of the generated Xcode scheme.

variable.name: CMAKE_XCODE_SCHEME_MALLOC_GUARD_EDGES
variable.desc: Whether to enable Malloc Guard Edges in the Diagnostics section of the generated Xcode scheme.

variable.name: CMAKE_XCODE_SCHEME_MALLOC_SCRIBBLE
variable.desc: Whether to enable Malloc Scribble in the Diagnostics section of the generated Xcode scheme.

variable.name: CMAKE_XCODE_SCHEME_MALLOC_STACK
variable.desc: Whether to enable Malloc Stack in the Diagnostics section of the generated Xcode scheme.

variable.name: CMAKE_XCODE_SCHEME_THREAD_SANITIZER
variable.desc: Whether to enable Thread Sanitizer in the Diagnostics section of the generated Xcode scheme.

variable.name: CMAKE_XCODE_SCHEME_THREAD_SANITIZER_STOP
variable.desc: Whether to enable Thread Sanitizer - Pause on issues in the Diagnostics section of the generated Xcode scheme.

variable.name: CMAKE_XCODE_SCHEME_UNDEFINED_BEHAVIOUR_SANITIZER
variable.desc: Whether to enable Undefined Behavior Sanitizer in the Diagnostics section of the generated Xcode scheme.

variable.name: CMAKE_XCODE_SCHEME_UNDEFINED_BEHAVIOUR_SANITIZER_STOP
variable.desc: Whether to enable Undefined Behavior Sanitizer option Pause on issues in the Diagnostics section of the generated Xcode scheme.

variable.name: CMAKE_XCODE_SCHEME_WORKING_DIRECTORY
variable.desc: Specify the Working Directory of the Run and Profile actions in the generated Xcode scheme.

variable.name: CMAKE_XCODE_SCHEME_ZOMBIE_OBJECTS
variable.desc: Whether to enable Zombie Objects in the Diagnostics section of the generated Xcode scheme.

variable.name: CPACK_ABSOLUTE_DESTINATION_FILES
variable.desc: List of files which have been installed using an ABSOLUTE DESTINATION path.

variable.name: CPACK_COMPONENT_INCLUDE_TOPLEVEL_DIRECTORY
variable.desc: Boolean toggle to include/exclude top level directory (component case).

variable.name: CPACK_ERROR_ON_ABSOLUTE_INSTALL_DESTINATION
variable.desc: Ask CPack to error out as soon as a file with absolute INSTALL DESTINATION is encountered.

variable.name: CPACK_INCLUDE_TOPLEVEL_DIRECTORY
variable.desc: Boolean toggle to include/exclude top level directory.

variable.name: CPACK_INSTALL_DEFAULT_DIRECTORY_PERMISSIONS
variable.desc: Default permissions for implicitly created directories during packaging.

variable.name: CPACK_PACKAGING_INSTALL_PREFIX
variable.desc: The prefix used in the built package.

variable.name: CPACK_SET_DESTDIR
variable.desc: Boolean toggle to make CPack use DESTDIR mechanism when packaging.

variable.name: CPACK_WARN_ON_ABSOLUTE_INSTALL_DESTINATION
variable.desc: Ask CPack to warn each time a file with absolute INSTALL DESTINATION is encountered.

variable.name: CTEST_BINARY_DIRECTORY
variable.desc: Specify the CTest BuildDirectory setting in a ctest(1) dashboard client script.

variable.name: CTEST_BUILD_COMMAND
variable.desc: Specify the CTest MakeCommand setting in a ctest(1) dashboard client script.

variable.name: CTEST_BUILD_NAME
variable.desc: Specify the CTest BuildName setting in a ctest(1) dashboard client script.

variable.name: CTEST_BZR_COMMAND
variable.desc: Specify the CTest BZRCommand setting in a ctest(1) dashboard client script.

variable.name: CTEST_BZR_UPDATE_OPTIONS
variable.desc: Specify the CTest BZRUpdateOptions setting in a ctest(1) dashboard client script.

variable.name: CTEST_CHANGE_ID
variable.desc: Specify the CTest ChangeId setting in a ctest(1) dashboard client script.

variable.name: CTEST_CHECKOUT_COMMAND
variable.desc: Tell the ctest_start() command how to checkout or initialize the source directory in a ctest(1) dashboard client script.

variable.name: CTEST_CONFIGURATION_TYPE
variable.desc: Specify the CTest DefaultCTestConfigurationType setting in a ctest(1) dashboard client script.

variable.name: CTEST_CONFIGURE_COMMAND
variable.desc: Specify the CTest ConfigureCommand setting in a ctest(1) dashboard client script.

variable.name: CTEST_COVERAGE_COMMAND
variable.desc: Specify the CTest CoverageCommand setting in a ctest(1) dashboard client script.

variable.name: CTEST_COVERAGE_EXTRA_FLAGS
variable.desc: Specify the CTest CoverageExtraFlags setting in a ctest(1) dashboard client script.

variable.name: CTEST_CURL_OPTIONS
variable.desc: Specify the CTest CurlOptions setting in a ctest(1) dashboard client script.

variable.name: CTEST_CUSTOM_COVERAGE_EXCLUDE
variable.desc: A list of regular expressions which will be used to exclude files by their path from coverage output by the ctest_coverage() command.

variable.name: CTEST_CUSTOM_ERROR_EXCEPTION
variable.desc: A list of regular expressions which will be used to exclude when detecting error messages in build outputs by the ctest_test() command.

variable.name: CTEST_CUSTOM_ERROR_MATCH
variable.desc: A list of regular expressions which will be used to detect error messages in build outputs by the ctest_test() command.

variable.name: CTEST_CUSTOM_ERROR_POST_CONTEXT
variable.desc: The number of lines to include as context which follow an error message by the ctest_test() command. The default is 10.

variable.name: CTEST_CUSTOM_ERROR_PRE_CONTEXT
variable.desc: The number of lines to include as context which precede an error message by the ctest_test() command. The default is 10.

variable.name: CTEST_CUSTOM_MAXIMUM_FAILED_TEST_OUTPUT_SIZE
variable.desc: When saving a failing test’s output, this is the maximum size, in bytes, that will be collected by the ctest_test() command. Defaults to 307200 (300 KiB).

variable.name: CTEST_CUSTOM_MAXIMUM_NUMBER_OF_ERRORS
variable.desc: The maximum number of errors in a single build step which will be detected. After this, the ctest_test() command will truncate the output. Defaults to 50.

variable.name: CTEST_CUSTOM_MAXIMUM_NUMBER_OF_WARNINGS
variable.desc: The maximum number of warnings in a single build step which will be detected. After this, the ctest_test() command will truncate the output. Defaults to 50.

variable.name: CTEST_CUSTOM_MAXIMUM_PASSED_TEST_OUTPUT_SIZE
variable.desc: When saving a passing test’s output, this is the maximum size, in bytes, that will be collected by the ctest_test() command. Defaults to 1024 (1 KiB).

variable.name: CTEST_CUSTOM_MEMCHECK_IGNORE
variable.desc: A list of regular expressions to use to exclude tests during the ctest_memcheck() command.

variable.name: CTEST_CUSTOM_POST_MEMCHECK
variable.desc: A list of commands to run at the end of the ctest_memcheck() command.

variable.name: CTEST_CUSTOM_POST_TEST
variable.desc: A list of commands to run at the end of the ctest_test() command.

variable.name: CTEST_CUSTOM_PRE_MEMCHECK
variable.desc: A list of commands to run at the start of the ctest_memcheck() command.

variable.name: CTEST_CUSTOM_PRE_TEST
variable.desc: A list of commands to run at the start of the ctest_test() command.

variable.name: CTEST_CUSTOM_TESTS_IGNORE
variable.desc: A list of regular expressions to use to exclude tests during the ctest_test() command.

variable.name: CTEST_CUSTOM_WARNING_EXCEPTION
variable.desc: A list of regular expressions which will be used to exclude when detecting warning messages in build outputs by the ctest_build() command.

variable.name: CTEST_CUSTOM_WARNING_MATCH
variable.desc: A list of regular expressions which will be used to detect warning messages in build outputs by the ctest_build() command.

variable.name: CYGWIN
variable.desc: True for Cygwin.

variable.name: ENV
variable.desc: Operator to read environment variables.

variable.name: EXECUTABLE_OUTPUT_PATH
variable.desc: Old executable location variable.

variable.name: GHS-MULTI
variable.desc: True when using Green Hills MULTI generator.

variable.name: IOS
variable.desc: Set to 1 when the target system (CMAKE_SYSTEM_NAME) is iOS.

variable.name: LIBRARY_OUTPUT_PATH
variable.desc: Old library location variable.

variable.name: MINGW
variable.desc: True when using MinGW

variable.name: MSVC
variable.desc: Set to true when the compiler is some version of Microsoft Visual C++ or another compiler simulating Visual C++. Any compiler defining _MSC_VER is considered simulating Visual C++.

variable.name: MSVC10
variable.desc: Discouraged. Use the MSVC_VERSION variable instead.

variable.name: MSVC11
variable.desc: Discouraged. Use the MSVC_VERSION variable instead.

variable.name: MSVC12
variable.desc: Discouraged. Use the MSVC_VERSION variable instead.

variable.name: MSVC14
variable.desc: Discouraged. Use the MSVC_VERSION variable instead.

variable.name: MSVC60
variable.desc: Discouraged. Use the MSVC_VERSION variable instead.

variable.name: MSVC70
variable.desc: Discouraged. Use the MSVC_VERSION variable instead.

variable.name: MSVC71
variable.desc: Discouraged. Use the MSVC_VERSION variable instead.

variable.name: MSVC80
variable.desc: Discouraged. Use the MSVC_VERSION variable instead.

variable.name: MSVC90
variable.desc: Discouraged. Use the MSVC_VERSION variable instead.

variable.name: MSVC_IDE
variable.desc: True when using the Microsoft Visual C++ IDE.

variable.name: MSVC_TOOLSET_VERSION
variable.desc: The toolset version of Microsoft Visual C/C++ being used if any. If MSVC-like is being used, this variable is set based on the version of the compiler as given by the MSVC_VERSION variable.

variable.name: MSVC_VERSION
variable.desc: The version of Microsoft Visual C/C++ being used if any. If a compiler simulating Visual C++ is being used, this variable is set to the toolset version simulated as given by the _MSC_VER preprocessor definition.

variable.name: MSYS
variable.desc: True when using the MSYS Makefiles generator.

variable.name: PROJECT_BINARY_DIR
variable.desc: Full path to build directory for project.

variable.name: PROJECT_DESCRIPTION
variable.desc: Short project description given to the project command.

variable.name: PROJECT_HOMEPAGE_URL
variable.desc: The homepage URL of the project.

variable.name: PROJECT_NAME
variable.desc: Name of the project given to the project command.

variable.name: PROJECT_SOURCE_DIR
variable.desc: This is the source directory of the last call to the project() command made in the current directory scope or one of its parents. Note, it is not affected by calls to project() made within a child directory scope (i.e. from within a call to add_subdirectory() from the current scope).

variable.name: PROJECT_VERSION
variable.desc: Value given to the VERSION option of the most recent call to the project() command, if any.

variable.name: PROJECT_VERSION_MAJOR
variable.desc: First version number component of the PROJECT_VERSION variable as set by the project() command.

variable.name: PROJECT_VERSION_MINOR
variable.desc: Second version number component of the PROJECT_VERSION variable as set by the project() command.

variable.name: PROJECT_VERSION_PATCH
variable.desc: Third version number component of the PROJECT_VERSION variable as set by the project() command.

variable.name: PROJECT_VERSION_TWEAK
variable.desc: Fourth version number component of the PROJECT_VERSION variable as set by the project() command.

variable.name: UNIX
variable.desc: Set to True when the target system is UNIX or UNIX-like (e.g. APPLE and CYGWIN). The CMAKE_SYSTEM_NAME variable should be queried if a more specific understanding of the target system is required.

variable.name: WIN32
variable.desc: Set to True when the target system is Windows, including Win64.

variable.name: WINCE
variable.desc: True when the CMAKE_SYSTEM_NAME variable is set to WindowsCE.

variable.name: WINDOWS_PHONE
variable.desc: True when the CMAKE_SYSTEM_NAME variable is set to WindowsPhone.

variable.name: WINDOWS_STORE
variable.desc: True when the CMAKE_SYSTEM_NAME variable is set to WindowsStore.

variable.name: XCODE
variable.desc: True when using Xcode generator.

variable.name: XCODE_VERSION
variable.desc: Version of Xcode (Xcode generator only).
